Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay away from downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Jim P
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay when you want to be outside of the downtown area. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms and bed are comfortable and the hotel is never noisy. I got a business style room for $100/night which i thikn is is a great deal for Chicago. Red line train is about 1/2 mile walk. There is a lot of retail, restaurant and bar choices within walking distance. The only negatives for me are valet parking and old style TVs (need to update to LCD).

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: VallenatoJuan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week over Spring Break. The hotel's best asset is its location. It is very conveniently located just about 3-4 blocks from the train station, the Lincoln Park Zoo & Park (free) and several other amenities such as restaurants, pubs, shops, etc. We felt very safe in the neighborhood and were happy to have chosen this location. The hotel is also very clean inside and out and has courteous, friendly staff. We also made an advance purchase for our room and got them at $88/night for a King bedroom which is a great rate. The drawbacks of the hotel are the breakfast, which, in my opinion, is truly a bare-bones continental. Rolls, waffles, doughnuts, that sort of stuff. But no eggs, ham, sausage or things that will truly hold you up through the morning. The breakfast room is also long but very narrow and doesn't seem to accomodate hotel guests too well at any one time, it always seem crammed and crowded. The actual room also seem small by most King-bed rooms nowdays. Overall, a good value when you consider we were only paying $88 for the location, but if we go and stay there again next time we'll budget for eating breakfast elsewhere around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: MamaFish52
Reviews.Content: My son and I went on our first trip to Chicago to visit DePaul University. Days Inn Chicago was one of the recommended hotels through the DePaul website. I called several hotels and Days Inn offered a great rate. I opted for the larger room, which included 2 queen beds and a fridge. Usually, hotels look better in the photos you see ahead of time, but in this case, not only did the Days Inn deliver what it seemed to be by the website and photos, it hugely exceeded my expectations. The room itself was immaculate! The bedding was plush, white cotton, and the beds were so comfortable. I am often "skeeved out" by the bedspreads in hotels, but Days Inn uses white cotton duvets, which appear to cleaned and replaced with the fresh linens daily. That went a long way in making me feel the place was clean. The only drawback of this room, and I suspect the others as well, was that there is no vanity in the bathroom. The sink was a pedastal sink, making it a little inconvenient to not have a place to put down my toiletries, except for a small glass shelf above the sink. But then, I have a lot of toiletries and makeup and I'm used to spreading my stuff out. The bathroom did have a towel warmer though, which was a really nice feature, especially on the chilly mornings!! Our room was on the second floor, facing the street. I did hear some traffic, but didn't find it to be a negative. I signed up for a vacation in the city, so it was welcome. And when it snowed one night, we were able to watch the snow fall over the city street. Pretty cool (we're Floridians, so it was pretty novel for us). Best of all, there was an Urban Outfitters AND a Trader Joe's literally across the street. Loved it. The hotel is an older building (I think it was built around 1920) but has been renovated. The continental breakfast was standard fare and fine. Nothing fancy, but I'm not a big breakfast eater, so it was perfectly fine. And free. Cereals, fruit, oatmeal, bagels, juices and coffee, and make your own belgian waffles. It was enough. What I really have to compliment the most, though, is the service at the front desk. Being brand new to Chicago, I had no idea how to get around, where to go find the best deep dish pizza in Chicago, where to buy a CTA public transportation pass, etc. The folks at the front desk were so helpful, consistently. Can't say enough about them!! The hotel was located in Lincoln Park, north of downtown, and required a bus or train ride into the heart of the city. Bus took longer because it stopped every block or so, but I preferred it. Even though it took a little getting to to get into downtown, I still felt like the hotel was part of the city, which I wanted, and the rate was unbeatable. We stayed 4 nights, and it didn't break the bank. If you've never been to Chicago, don't miss Lou Malnati's pizza (walkable from the hotel), Italian Beef Sandwiches from Portillo's on Ontario Street (OMG!!), and The Field Museum. It was truly a fantastic trip, largely because of a great hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Thomas C
Reviews.Content: I visited Chicago for about 5 days in October 2011 on the weekend which happened to conflict with the Chicago Marathon, so many of the downtown Chicago hotels were booked up. I ended up staying here at the Days Inn for 2 nights because of its proximity to Diversey station which took me downtown pretty quickly (~15-20 minutes depending on time of day). I wasn't expecting much for the price but was satisfied with what I got, which was a double bed room. The hotel was quiet, customer service was good, and overall a very decent stay. There was also free wifi. The only thing was that the washroom could use a little updating.

Reviews.Title: “Got what was expected”
Reviews.Author: sarainsantiago
Reviews.Content: After our stay in New Orleans, we are easy to please when it comes to lodgings: clean, safe, functioning wifi, and possibly a filling breakfast? Yes, please! Did Days Inn Chicago provide these? That they did. The hotel is an old building that seems to have been restored, but maintains the labyrinthe hallways that are ill-marked and make finding your room for the first time difficult - especially if you decide to carry your own luggage, as we did. Our room was small, but clean. The temperature was a but hard to control. The breakfast was buffet style with hot waffles. I was a fan ;) The staff was apathetic and not very helpful when it came to answering our questions. I'm not sure if tipping them would have helped? It shouldn't have. The big negative of this hotel is that you have to pay for parking. I know...I know it is like that all over Chicago, but a hotel needs to be very specific and tell a traveler that they should add $25 for their car's nightly room and board. Also, the parking garage that the hotel had an agreement with was at least three blocks from the hotel. Not a fun walk in the winter with suitcases! Fortunately, the hotel is close to several tourist destinations on foot - if you are into walking - and close to the train, for everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Well run hotel in great neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: bndrdndt88
Reviews.Content: Booked a business room for a fun weekend. Many places within walking distance. Great resaurants, music clubs, comedy clubs, shopping. I like the neighborhood. The rooms were clean and the front desk was helpful. Only reason not 5 star was noisey furnace/heater, it really roared when it kicked in, and noisey cleaning crew. I know they have a hard job to do, but they don't have to let me hear it all day long. I swear the vacuum gal ran that vacuum all afternoon down my hall. But at least she was keeping the place clean. Used comp Ballys for a workout one day and it is a very good workout facility. That was very much appreciated. I hope they keep up the agreement with Ballys. All in all it is a great place to stay, helpful valet, helpful front desk and great location. Would stay again. WARNING: Stay away from a diner on Lincoln called Clarkes Bar and Grill: Very bad service and food. Every other place we dined and drank at was up to Chicago's high standards. Blue Man Group and Zaneys were great for enterntainment. Will go back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but avoid the small "Double" rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kristin F
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night at this hotel while in Chicago. Location is fantastic if you're in the Lincoln Park/Lakeview area of town. Valet parking was reasonably priced; we turned the car over and walked everywhere. However, our room was one of the smallest and most uncomfortable I've stayed in. We had a double/full size (not queen) bed, with horrible pillows, and barely enough room to walk between the TV and the bed. The bathroom had no counter space at all. The shower head came out of the side of the wall, had very low water pressure and the faucet handle came off during a shower. My other complaint was that the hotel boasts a fitness center, but I found out there's not one on-site, but rather around the corner at franchised gym. Having said all that, I would consider returning - in a bigger room - simply for location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong information on website and little caring from staff”
Reviews.Author: laura_w224
Reviews.Content: I'm staying in this hotel right now. They say on their site they have access to a health club - they DON'T. One of the major reasons I booked the hotel was because their website says they have access to a health club right next door - we're travelling for 6 months then going home to get married and it's really important to us to exercise while we're away. We checked with the front desk girl on our first morning and she gave us directions to the gym. When we got there we were informed that the gym had changed hands 3 months earlier and there has been no agreement with Days Inn since then. We went back and the front desk guy said there had been negotiations and he would ask the GM what was going on. We went out for the day and checked back in the afternoon. One of the afternoon staff - the front desk supervisor - went and asked the GM when we got back. He returned to say no, there is no access, they are still working on it. I told him I wasn't very happy with this as one of the major reasons I booked the hotel was because they said they had gym access. He sarcastically informed me there was a lake I could run around 4 blocks away - I replied that I don't have running gear suitable for 0 degrees Celsius temperatures. I asked if he knew that it said on the website they have a gym, and he replied, "yes, but it still says Bally's too" - the name of the old gym franchise. I have no idea what this is supposed to do with the fact they haven't bothered to update their website information in 3 months - as I said to him, I should be able to trust the information on THEIR site and not have to fact-check. Other than that the hotel is fine. We were checked into an accessible room which was a little weird but not an issue, there is just a very large bathroom with 2 showers - I've just never had it happen before when there are other rooms available. I asked about this after we first saw the room and the same supervisor told me it was booked that way - I double checked my booking email and it just says 'standard room'. Was wondering if the other bedrooms might be larger if they don't have such a huge bathroom. Location is fine, the valet parking is easy, the other desk guy this afternoon was pleasant and the breakfast has a good selection. The health club issue is a major one for me as I feel I was misled and they don't care at all..

Reviews.Title: “If you're staying in this part of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: NAA304
Reviews.Content: If you need to be in the Lincoln Park area of Chicago, you could not find a more convenient or comfortable place than this. It is located in a vibrant part of the city with lots of restaurants, stores and upscale neighborhood businesses. It is safe, clean, and the staff is very helpful and available. If you like a nice, old hotel with thoroughly modern accomodations, this is it! And for the price, it can't be beat. It has atmosphere, location, price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: 5weetooth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five nights, and my experience throughout was nothing short of outstanding. I was at first greeting my amazingly kind staff, who made check-in a breeze. I was soon greeted by a beautiful room, which was simple, but very practical and clean. With free continental breakfast every day offering a diverse selection of goodies, I will definitely stay here again. After flying from Australia I needed a good night's sleep, and that's exactly what I got every single night. Do not look elsewhere, this is put simply the best place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: labower
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Comfortable bed, clean room, good breakfast. Friendly staff, especially Anthony, who answered our questions and helped us with checkin. Not a quiet hotel -- the staff was vacuuming or cleaning a room up the hall in the afternoon. It sounded like it was right outside the door. But we had earplugs. In fact, the hotel provides earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Always the best!”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Days Inn, Diversey, every year since 2006. It is one of the best deals in Chicago, great location, great staff, excellent rooms, clean and they always give us the best! You can't beat the location, and if you're lucky enough to get an upgrade (or book one yourself) be business rooms are the best value in a great city! We'll be back again, for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: Carrington D
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay at the Days Inn. It was great! The room was simple and small, but clean, inviting and was perfect for what we needed. PLUS - it was about 4 blocks from the L and everything was right there! Great Location!!!!! Highly Reccomend and will retun for sure! Staff was friendly and helpful.. Pictures online that they post are accurate. Good Job Days Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: Ralph K
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels in Chicago. This was my first stay here. The staff go out of there duty call for the guest! They make you feel at home. The "L train is only 4blks away. Bus stop in front of building. I forgot a RX when I packed Walgreens 1blk got my RX. Great food within a few blocks. Breakfast was cool I'm going to miss the "easy-bake" waffle machine. The valet parking guys that service guests were always ready to flag a cab or open a door, unload luggage if needed. I stayed 5days in a budget room. It was very comfortable. Wifi was flawless on I-pad, I-pod, XP netbook and Win7 laptop. Bed was very just right for a 6'-01" 295lbs person. My only negative was having to checkout vacation over and go back to work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Value in a eclectic neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Fryfly
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive about staying in a Days Inn, as I am usually a four star kind of laday and usually stay downtown. I chose this hotel due to its proximity to DePaul University. I must say, that I was pleasantly surprised by the physical appearance of the rooms and the lobby! The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and comfy and the free breakfast is good. I love the neighborhood, there are trendy national brand stores (Urban Outfitter, Trader Joes, Starbucks) mixed in with local favorites. Guests have complimentary access to Bally's. It is a very walkable and joggable neighborhood, imagine my surprise one morning when I literally ran into a zoo and beautiful gardens during one of my early morning jogs. Weather permitting, we usually walk to DePaul during visits to see our son and the discount for DePaul parents is a great plus. I appreciate the hotel's efforts at being green, though I am not so sure of what happens to the breakfast trash and would like to see more eco-friendly serveware. Try it you'll like it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel next to Gold Coast”
Reviews.Author: globbetrot
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with great rooms. A lot of space in the rooms. The breakfast buffet offers a lot. Making your own waffles is amusing. Reception staff gives good information. Good situation. The only negative thing is the noice on the street at night. When we asked a room on the backside, it was not possible but the nice receptionist gave us a business room (with 2 bathrooms and a sitting room) on the backside for 9$ a night!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JetsForFunJourneys
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for one night. The staff was friendly. The rooms were small, but clean. The hotel offered free continental breakfast. For parking, it is best to go to the adjacent mall and park there.

Reviews.Title: “Little hot water in shower or sink, otherwise a bargain hunters delight, great neighborhood hotel--Trader Joes across st”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Do you like staying where the locals live instead of a downtown chain? Free use of the Ballys Health Club next door (including indoor pool). Great restaurants and shops steps from hotel. Take public transit (152, 156, Brown Line) to both airports, downtown, etc. Nice breakfast. Clean rooms. Polish speaking staff (yes, everyone speaks Polish who works there). Still, hot water is nice in the shower and while I like saving energy, I also like a little hot water. RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Gatoric
Reviews.Content: Don't let the Days Inn name fool you. I had second thoughts about reserving here, but fears were laid to rest after check in. There is a bus stop right outside the front door or it's just a short walk to the El station; lots of shopping, restaurants, and bars nearby, so the location is prime. The rates for this property, just north of downtown is much less than what you'll pay there. Parking is valet or self-park. I had a car for just one day and was able to park myself on the street and avoid both those options just 3 blocks away. If a car is an option for a longer period, the valet may be the best bet. The room itself was excellent, clean and comfortable. All the amenities you'd expect then some. Had a business room that included daily bottled water, power bar and popcorn. Based on previous reviews, requested and got an inside room that was quiet. Only once during my 3 days did I hear outside noise - that of a nearby fire truck. Breakfast was fresh and abundant. The breakfast room itself was a little cramped. Front desk staff was well-informed and friendly. An overall excellent stay - I'll be back next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JohnMaloney
Reviews.Content: Must be the cleanest hotel in America! Excellent location with good bars and resturants very nearby. 10 minute walk to the 151/156 buses which will take you to all the attractions. Lovely rooms and beds. Excellent complimentary breakfast. staff endlessly helpful. Even stored our cases when we went away for three days. Diversey is a very nice area to stay in. fairly easy access to the L-line train from O'hare airport. Just get off at lake and get a cab. Again..this hotel was spotless. Highly recommended. Punches well above its star rating..

Reviews.Title: “Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JAJ A
Reviews.Content: I found the Staff to be very friendly and helpful. The location was perfect in the middle of lots of shops, restaurants, bars and transport. Since it was on a busy street it was very noisy and sometimes difficult to sleep in. Since our trip was very short (3 days) we didn't mind waking up slightly early. The rooms are very small but very very clean. I recommend this hotel for budget group stays, business travellers and for those who are planning to stay for a short weekend and want a clean place to rest their heads.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: Marshabill
Reviews.Content: We went to Lincoln Park Apollo Theatre to see MILLION DOLLAR QUARTET and wanted to stay nearby. We found the Days Inn through other reviews on TripAdvisor and we were very pleased. Yes, the rooms are small but it was adequate for a one-two night stay...very clean, front desk and other employees were very helpful and nice. The breakfast in the morning was more than ample and the attendant there was nice as well. Within walking distance of the theatre and a lot of good shopping and great restaurants. Ate at Michael Diversey's and it was wonderful as well. Couldn't say enough nice things. We used the valet parking which was really cheap considering we didn't have to worry about our car during out entire stay. It was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ScottyG777
Reviews.Content: It's hard to beat Chicago, it's such a great city. I haven't stayed in up this area of Chicago before but I had a couple of assignments in the Lincoln Park area and after reading the reviews on this hotel I decided to stay at the Days Inn. It couldn't have been better than it was, it's a great little hotel. I know that valet parking is a fact of life in big cities, or at almost any downtown hotel, but I'm not a huge fan of it. As a photographer, I need my car several times a day as the sun moves around a building and it's somewhat of a hassle to have to keep going to the valet folks to get my car to go to the project site, not to mention the expense of tipping everytime. But, that's a part of life in the big city. The valet guys here were super nice and super fast. That being said, the hotel itself was outstanding for such a tight space that it's in. I had a business suite which was a little bigger than a regular room and included a much-needed desk area. The bed was great and I didn't notice any outside or adjacent room noise really that I can remember. The bathroom was nice although a bit tight just because of the space limitations of such a small hotel. I didn't eat the breakfast because it was pretty carb-heavy and there was a Starbucks right across the street so I did that instead. They had a nice little sitting / dining area for the breakfast and there were quite a few folks in there when I went down to check it out. The room had a small fridge and microwave and ironing board, hair dryer, nice, thick towels and all the things you've come to expect from a hice hotel chain in a location like this. The location of this hotel is great, it's close enough to downtown that you can sneak down there using streets instead of the freeway which is quicker. Or, hop on the L which is probably a better idea since then you don't have to pay for parking once you get downtown. I paid $100 for my room which was an absolute steal for Chicago and for such a nice hotel. The parking was $24 a day, plus tips, so I probably paid $150 a day total with tax; not bad at all for semi-downtown Chicago in a super clean, nice hotel. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susyny2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been visiting Chicago at least once a year for the last 11 yrs to visit our son and daughter in law.. Days Inn Chicago is the hotel nearest to their place, so that is the one we picked the first time. At that time the hotel was under renovations but we liked it enough to return and stay there. The only two times we have not been able to stay were because the hotel didn't have rooms available. Needless to say through the years, it has developed into a boutique hotel and it is very much in demand, to a point where we have to make reservations a year in advance to be able to get a room. The area is withing the city but away from the hustled and bustled of downtown. Transportation to downtown is easy and available.. one good point, it is close to Wrigley Field. Also have free breakfast and it is beautifully decorated during the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “"Some improvements needed"”
Reviews.Author: brucegordon2
Reviews.Content: This property is, as most reviews here show, clean, well-maintained, friendly staff, great location, good breakfast, etc. However, my stay was less than acceptable due to internal and external noise. Street and pedestrian traffic are facts of city life. But that said, I tried a street view room and the noise was quite disturbing. Thought of relocating to an interior room but realized the room doors bang shut and the service staff carried on loudly so this would have been moot. I believe it wouldn't take much to replace existing windows with a more soundproof variety. Only other complaint was the under-window AC/heating units, which, even on the lowest fan speed setting, would preclude a normal conversation in a room and require TV sound to be up very high to hear it. I will not choose this property again, unless and until I learn that appropriate noise limiting features have been added, and I know they could be.

Reviews.Title: “"The Little Hotel That Could!"”
Reviews.Author: DONA C
Reviews.Content: I really felt like this hotel was "The Little Hotel that Could!". Here are the awesome parts: The location is really good, the hotel was very clean and orderly and the staff (especially Neil at the front desk!!) was super friendly and nice. It was obvious to me that the people who run this hotel really care about providing a quality atmosphere to their guests - even the stairway was spotless and had pictures hanging at every level! My husband and I stayed there for one night, and I would definitely stay there again. Here's the downside: It is an older hotel and it shows. The TV's are the big tube kind and the decor/furniture, while super clean and in good condition, is kind of old looking. Overall, I'd say this hotel is an excellent value in a great location and it really seems like the people who run the place care.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood Inn”
Reviews.Author: margiemi
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect place for us to stay while visiting our college kid who lives In Lakeview. We were walking distance to everything we needed. The hotel was clean and everyone was very friendly. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Average Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: jsguyrus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights. It is located about six block from the CTA brown line Deversey Station. You can take the train directly into downtown or with one transfer to either airport. The neighborhood is very safe and walkable with numerous restaurants, bars, stores and markets within two blocks. The hotel itself is proably the most upscale Days Inn you would ever find. The building is older but has been updated. Rooms vary from quite small to roomy.A free breakfast is served until 11am each morning. All rooms have free wi-fi which works very well. Be aware it is valet only parking. It really is quite a nice hotel. The only downside is it is in a busy neighborhood and rooms that face the street get A LOT of street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat guest”
Reviews.Author: Otoh
Reviews.Content: I always try to stay here if possible--must book early. It's the best value in Chicago. The room is basic but comfortable. It's in a great neighborhood--good restaurants, shops, Trader Joe's, free access to Ballys Fitness Club, and a very nice indie movie theater around the corner. Steps to the EL and a manageable walk to DePaul University. Good breakfast complete with waffles is included. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!!!”
Reviews.Author: hudsontravel1
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay through Priceline- although not "name your own price" so actually no cheaper than if we had gone through hotel directly. At any rate, our room was closet-sized and the window at the intersection of two busy streets. The noise made it impossible to sleep (did not bode well when we saw the room comes equipped with earplugs). The bed is also listed on website as a double but was smaller and shorter than any double we have ever slept in. Maybe to fit into such a tiny room? I will say the next morning when we asked to be moved to a different room they accommodated us, but it was a long, MISERABLE night of no sleep with the constant street noise of vehicles, sirens, horns honking etc. with no compensation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: rr26
Reviews.Content: I was very unsure about this hotel, being so small. My daughter was getting married and my SIL arranged rooms here. What a great place! Great price, valet parking @ $22/ night (in and out privileges) was cheap (check it out at other Chi hotels) and the valet service was super fast. Room was smallish, but very nice, well appointed w/ many amenities (Microwave, fridge, safe,and coffee maker) you never see in a small hotel and some large ones. The complimentary breakfast was great. Coffee, juices, bagels, and waffles...what else could you ask? Clean doesn't begin to explain it, as it was immaculate! Special kudo to Eric (Valet, porter, the guy who brings your bags to and from the room)! You did a great job! Very fast, efficient, and friendly. We had a lot of stuff in and out all weekend and he was perfect. But so was the desk staff, maids, and valets. There were many people from out of town staying here and I'm sure they would echo my comments. I have stayed at many high to medium level hotels all over the country. This place could compete w/ them all and win. Absolutely nothing bad to say. Definitely staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: cbw_1066
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for 3 nights and it was comfortable.Lots of restaurant choices in walking distance.With our CTA pass we had unlimited choices for bus and train connections, which came in handy to visit many areas.The bathroom was small but sufficient for a short time.Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Bobman14224
Reviews.Content: Great location, great room, great service, great stores (new Trader Joe's across the street), great restaurants. Pick interior rooms for better noise control due to traffic noise outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great, inexpensive hotel close to Wrigley Field”
Reviews.Author: jstew34
Reviews.Content: Location and cost are the reasons we choose this hotel when visiting Chicago. This is the third time staying there. If you want big name stores and eateries then don't stay here. The neighborhood has many boutique stores and great mom and pop restaurants. This property is old but has been renovated. The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly. The location is exactly 1 mile south of Wrigley Field.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Solotravel-lover
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I traveled to Chicago to celebrate the successful completion of his cancer therapy. We chose to have 2 standard single rooms, were assigned neighboring rooms which were quite comfortable and adequate. Housekeeping services were excellent. We were able to walk to Wrigley Field for a baseball game, the Lincoln Park Zoo, and assorted other tourist-ish and shopping attractions. Lots of good restaurant options nearby. Valet parking was prompt and courteous. Front desk helpful. Room toiletries standard, except for the thoughtful inclusion of earplugs, which I've not seen at other hotels. Continental breakfast included. Rates were very reasonable. Public transportation conveniently nearby, although we didn't use it on this trip. We hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: dudekennedy
Reviews.Content: After moving to California three months ago away from Chicago, this Days Inn was my home-away-from home on business. I had a clean and quiet room complete with a very comfortable Queen size bed. Complimentary coffee, bottled water, and a granola bar were in my room, along with a free Continental breakfast in the lobby. I'd like to note that if any noise disturbed me, my bathroom had complimentary (wrapped/sanitary) ear plugs nestled by the shampoo and conditioner. The hotel staff were very attentive and made sure I enjoyed my stay. Great location and near lots of attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best Days Inn I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: alinemramos
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best Days-Inn I've ever stayed at. We were on a family trip and I didn't want to stay in downtown Chicago, so I found this to be just the perfect location: close to Lincoln Park (and the Lincoln Park Zoo), with a ton of shops and restaurants nearby, walking distance to the subway ("El") stop, and literally around the corner from the bus stop for buses that go downtown (in just about 20-30min.). The room was really nice (we got an upgrade to a business place room, so couldn't complain!), spacious, clean... The lobby was just beautiful and service was extremely attentive. They also have free breakfast, which is also quite good. Excellent cost-benefit. Can't beat the location. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Isssues”
Reviews.Author: ATLtoEUR767
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay in this hotel based on the location and it was only a short walk to the Lakeview area. Unfortunately Chicago has many hotels Downtown and inside the Loop but only a few options up north in the Lakeview/Wrigley Field area. After arriving to the hotel and checking into my room it was pretty clear that I paid too much for what I got. The room was a bit dated and my view looked directly into other hotel guest rooms, I had no city or street view at all. The internet worked well, the bed was low to the ground and not very comfy. On day 2 of my stay I received a call from the front desk stating they had a noise complaint coming from my room. I told him the only noise coming from my room was the phone when it rang being that I was sleep and there was no TV or radio on in my room and I was alone. He then stated that he was sure it was my room, at this point I told him to feel free to come up and inspect and I would be more than happy to let him in my room. The whole incident was seriously annoying but the bad service doesn't end there. After leaving the hotel and getting to the airport I realized I could not find my work cell phone. I called the desk and they transferred me to the housekeeping department. The person stated that they would have to wait until the housekeeper cleaning that room was done for the day before they would know if the phone was found. She stated she would call me back by the end of the day but I had heard nothing by the next day so I called back and left a message only to be ignored again. Of course it is my fault for leaving the phone but it is about the hotel service and how it was handled that disappointed me. I would not stay at this hotel again and due to elevated prices and limited options in the specific neighborhood I will get a 3 or 4 star room off Hotwire or Priceline for half the price and stay inside the loop.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, super-clean!”
Reviews.Author: RainefromNYC
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent--the staff was super-friendly and available (they have a doorman! We did not need a taxi or anything, so we didn't utilize him, but it was nice to have a friendly face each time we left the hotel). The location was good--near the Lincoln Park area and Wrigleyville. We were not in town long, so we did not go downtown or to the "mile", but it is only about three miles from that area.The rooms were not huge, but that's to be expected in a city hotel. The beds were AMAZING!!! Like the "heavenly bed" a certain other (much higher-priced) chain offers. Our room was extremely clean, and contained a mini-fridge and a microwave (great because I had a toddler with me). The free continental breakfast was plentiful and greatly appreciated. The seating was slightly cramped, but we went at around 9am and it was starting to empty out. There was a waffle maker, cereal, coffee, juice, etc. There were some delicious donuts, but those were gone by the time I got up there again. The beds were the best thing about the room . . . I can't think of anything I liked least--except maybe that you would have to pay for parking (we had access to a friend's private parking, which helped). This was a great deal and I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location,very clean,great price”
Reviews.Author: rei45
Reviews.Content: everything is at this location..restaurants,shopping,and easy walking and close to the El and busses...everyone was very friendly at this hotel...it was very clean..the continental breakfast was fresh and lots of choices....i was actually very surprised how nice this was and the price was very fair...we will be back again...if you want to be in lincoln park and near depaul university ...this is it.....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Cubs Game”
Reviews.Author: catwater07
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night last week while in town to see the Cubs. This hotel was in a perfect location, near enough to Wrigley to walk if you want (we walked, it took about 25 minutes or so), also close to a bus that goes straight there. It's also very close to Lincoln Park which was awesome to walk/run through, as well as being in the neighborhood with a bunch of smaller scale restaurants, bars and shops that looked like tons of fun. The hotel itself was nice, the beds were slightly hard, but worth it for the location, included breakfast, and nice staff. Will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: BMarshall123
Reviews.Content: This Day's Inn is in a great location, I was able to navigate Chicago's public transportation and get anywhere I wanted within the city (all the tourist attractions, and the airport.) The area is nice and safe to walk in with lots of stores and restaurants you can walk to. The hotel itself is cute and clean and the free breakfast was nice. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful with anything I needed. The room is tiny, but I was traveling alone so it's all I needed. However, because I booked through a travel website, I was led to believe that all the rooms had refrigerators and microwaves, due to them being listed on the site as amenities. When I got there, I learned that those are only in the upgraded business rooms and would coast and extra $60 per night. So keep that in mind. Also, my first room had a very strong smell of urine in one particular spot on the carpet- (probably a toddler accident, it happens) and I had to complain. But they moved me to another room, no questions asked. Some of the tvs have upgraded new flat screens, some of them still have big box tvs. I don't really care about this, but I noticed when I switched rooms. (For what it's worth, the big box tv in the first room worked fine, but the flat screen was a little screwy and would randomly turn off or stop responding to the remote.) In any case, I would stay here again, but probably only pay less than $100/night. I think it's worth that. They also charge for local calls, a slight annoyance because I had the misfortune to break my cell phone during my stay. If you are booking through a travel site, make sure you are actually getting a deal that is cheaper than directly through the hotel's site.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at great price!”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler99_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderfully located in the Lincoln Park area of Chicago, which has lots of wonderful shopping and restaurants (and is near the zoo, parks, and beaches). The hotel reminded us of a fancy European boutique hotel - it is modern, clean, very pretty, and the staff were extremely friendly. The breakfast had fine food, the room we had was spacious, and the beds were very comfortable. Guests also get to use the nearby Bally Fitness Center for free. It is definitely the best Days Inn we ever stayed in and we will definitely be returning. (Note that this hotel is not downtown, so if you need to be located in or near the Loop, it is probably not for you.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mpmiller
Reviews.Content: Travelled with a friend for a quick getaway. We were in a room with 2 beds, fridge, & micro(we were in room 403), room with views of Clark St. As always it was a great stay, staff very friendly, and willing to help in any way possible. If your not a continental b-fast kind-of-person, I would suggest The Golden Nugget one block south of Diversey on Clark.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel BUT factor in expensive parking!”
Reviews.Author: Heidi Z
Reviews.Content: Busy location but near train station to get into city. Big tick. Slap in the face is the $20 a day parking, but seems to be expensive everywhere, saw $45 a day in Chicago city! High quality hotel, nice rooms. Did ask for a inner facing room, but still got street view room. Was a bit noisy but noise level dropped between 12-7am so it was okay. Bathroom had a large step so stubbed my toe a bunch of times which was very irritating. Got a large king size bed, very comfortable. Decent breakfast with waffles and pastries. Slow lift and pricey internet access. Was close to an Aveda store which was like fate for me! Found a very cheap diner nearby that had main meals for $7.95 and delicious Red Velvet Cake. Overall happy but add $20 to the price of the room and decide if this is in your price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when Paul McCartney came to town. This is an exceptional property. We had a suite and it was fantastic. The hotel is immaculate, the front desk staff is friendly and really helpful. My room was ready before 2 p.m. and I didn't even request an early check-in. It's an older hotel so the elevators are small, but it is also secure as you can't get on a guest floor without a room key to activate the elevator. The valet parking is great. The breakfast was more than I expected for a complimentary offering at a Days Inn. Everything was fresh and continually replenished. Great location within walking distance to anything you could possibly need or want. I will stay here again and have recommended it to others who want to spend a weekend in the city at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “We would recommend this hotel to any Cubs fan (and the 2 people who aren't)”
Reviews.Author: Patti R
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to go to a night Cubs game, we stayed at this property. The staff was amazingly helpful and courteous. The accommodations were spacious, tastefully decorated, and very clean. Everything associated with this hotel was wonderful! We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone else, also.

Reviews.Title: “Tight fit”
Reviews.Author: MikeC196135805
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed to be an after thought between two buildings. The enterence was long and narrow leading to a small lobby and check-in desk. The elevator was small, slow, and hopped when it stopped at each floor. The room was small, but nice. The breakfast was good. I was most impressed with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Good buy near Lincoln Park”
Reviews.Author: Buzzhombre
Reviews.Content: This is an older 4 story hotel at Clark in Diversey, just a couple of blocks from Lincoln Park, the Lake, and Boystown. Not far from Wrigley Park, either. The rooms have been nicely renovated, and the Business Plus rooms are particularly nice, with microwave and refrigerator. There are MANY good places to eat in the area, and a good variety of night life. A great location for gay travelers. You'll also find lots of international guests. The have the longest hours on the continental breakfast of any hotel I've ever seen--6:30-11:00. There is a good variety of offerings at the breakfast, as well. Friendly staff. Valet parking is a bit pricey, but you don't really need a car, the El is about 5 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Cub Game Overnite”
Reviews.Author: Traci09
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was ready early (noon) so we were able to get checked in and leave our bags as we headed to the 1pm game. The room was small and all white, but clean and the bed was comfy. The doorman had taxis for us within a minute, which was great because we were running late. The next morning I skipped the free continental breakfast, it was just too crowded. Instead, I crossed the street to 2 of my fav stores... Trader Joe's and Urban Outfitters :)

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay with a good location!”
Reviews.Author: Luweez66
Reviews.Content: Everyone on the staff was very nice and helpful. The room and king size bed were very clean. Our room was equipped with microwave and refrigerator, which came in handy. The air-conditioner was a bit noisy but cooled the room quite well. The free breakfast was quite good, accommodating business people, families and couples, Fresh orange juice and grapefruit juice was served, the coffee was very good, there was a good selection of cereal, baked goods, bagels & waffles. The variety of jam, jelly and peanut butter was a pleasant surprise. There was even soy milk and fresh apples/oranges. The price wasn't bad either! The hotel is in a good location to the museums, aquarium and Lake Michigan. It's not a bad area to walk around, either!

Reviews.Title: “Phillies @ Cubs - We will be back! Great Town”
Reviews.Author: johnfizz
Reviews.Content: If you have the pleasure of staying here, hopefully you get to deal with Casey. He is a younger gentleman working the front desk and he made our trip even better. He was so helpful, let us keep our bags aside before check in, let us use a room to change before the game and even got us a room for an extra night due to a delayed flight! I have stayed in several hotels and had some great service but he really stood out and made things so easy for us out-of-towners. Cant wait to go back! Go Phillies!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Go Cubs Go!”
Reviews.Author: MarriedInBarbados
Reviews.Content: What a great location. Quiet in the room. Air works great. Beds are super comfy and extra pillows on each bed. Clean and spacious room. Super large closet. Nice clean bathroom. Would definitely stay here again. Cubs are about a 20 minute walk From the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: waltonway
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay here. I reserved a room with 2 double beds. The hotelâ€™s location in the Lincoln Park area is excellent, and one can easily walk to a variety of restaurants and bars. The valet parking is reasonable at $22 per day with unlimited in and out service. The complementary breakfast is good, and the WiFi is free. Access to Bally's fitness center is also free. This fitness center is excellent with a great view of the city and a great selection of machines, free weights, pool, and runing track.

Reviews.Title: “we had the best time ever! we will be returning when we travel here again soon!”
Reviews.Author: Justine43501
Reviews.Content: My family had the BEST experience here! The people were very friendly and courteous and looked out for all of our needs. I will recommend this hotel to everyone traveling to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A for Awesome”
Reviews.Author: psward
Reviews.Content: I usually don't spend the time to write a review, but this place is worth it. Our stay was for three days and we booked a room with two double beds. Upon arrival I was informed that we got an upgrade to have a room with two queen beds which meant also a larger room. This was great news. To me a hotel is only good if it is clean and quiet. Well, clean it is. Hotel cleaning staff was excellent and our room was kept well during our stay. No bad odors at all. Quiet, well the block itself is not so quiet, but the rooms were sound and we never heard anything within the hotel walls. I had the air on high at night and not a sound. Slept well there. It appears that the hotel was recently renovated. Everything was clean and looked good. Now don't go in expecting a high-rise hotel room. This place is quaint and quiet. Reminded me of European boutique hotels. Great location in Lincoln Park area. Wonderful non-chain restaurants within walking distance. Hotel staff was on the ball. Something you would expect from a high end hotel at 1/3 the cost. Cannot say enough about everyone who works there. OK I now sound like I am gushing, but it really was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sancho5a
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay when you are in the Lincoln Park area. Our family was here to search for an aparment for our daughter and we were thankful for this relaxing and clean place after a long day of house hunting. We will definitely return!! The hotel itself is newly renovated, very clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. You can do valet parking for a reasonable rate or you park your car yourself in a parking garage close by. The rooms are nicely decorated and this includes white linens and white towels. The beds are comfortable. The area around the hotel offers many lovely restaurants and little shops from groceries to clothings stores. This area gives you the best authentic feeling of the neighborhoods in Chicago. Ulrike, Bloomfield Hills, MI

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a Cubs game”
Reviews.Author: world_travelita
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend on June 18, 2011. We were in town to watch the Cubs play the Yankees and this hotel provided a great location with only a 15 minute walk to Wrigley. Parking was extra, but worth not having to worry about our car all weekend. Our room had one queen bed, an updated flat screen tv, and an updated bathroom and was considerably bigger than others I have stayed at in Chicago. The room was very clean. The only downfall I would mention is the bed was extremely hard! (Pillows were great though!) I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good, reasonably priced place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BunclodySenator
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Chicago to see friends, the first week of June. there was an Oncologists' congress in town, so it was hard to find a place to stay. A friend recommended the Days Inn Chicago. It is NOT the Ritz Carlton or the Peninsula, or the Four Seasons (hotels I've stayed in before, and which are all superb), but it was a fraction the price. I couldn't find a room under $600/night at the previous three, because of the congress. Including taxes etc, I paid less than $200/night . I got a very large sized room, with a king bed, a kitchenette, and a bathroom. there was even a flat screen TV. It was not the fanciest room I've ever had, but it was clean, spacious, and comfortable. And also quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “None better!”
Reviews.Author: fussy10_11
Reviews.Content: We found this to offer everything one could want. (Maybe we're partial because we got upgraded to the "business suite".) They stored our luggage when we arrived early in the day, the valet relieved us of our car and it was only a short distance to a bus to the city center at $2.25. The room was very clean and supplied the usual toiletries. Breakfast offered several choices. We felt very secure as one needs a key card to access the stairs or elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Trip to Meet Manfacturer”
Reviews.Author: roc94546
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago and the Days Inn on Diversey. What a wonderful experience with both. Chicago is a great city and the Day Inn was not only clean but comfortable. I also appreciated the old fashioned charm of the rooms. Friendly staff and fantastic complimentary breakfast. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to this part of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but ...”
Reviews.Author: WLL
Reviews.Content: Great staff and convenient location. If you like jazz, don't miss the Kingston Mines closeby, and if you are catholic, St Clement's church is a beautiful parish 10 mins slow pleasant walk in a nice residential area.close to hotel. Hemes Indian restaurant, a street away served authentic fresh Indian food. There's also a nice variety of restaurant choices within close proximity. Easy to get to McCormick Place. Hotel bedroom tho clean is tight and small, which naturally means a tiny toilet and bathroom. However everything is clean. We had a king size bed which was lumpy and uncomfortable and the aircon was noisy. We did not feel rested despite being completely tired after full day at convention..Did not want to fuss so decided will try another hotel next year. However the hotel has written to ask our feedback and has promised to check and get back to us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Soniab13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a step above what you'd expect from a Day's Inn. The service is exceptionally great, and the rooms are nice but small. I got an "upgrade" this visit and I be afraid of how small the un-upgraded rooms are! The size of the elevator is a good indicator of the room sizes. The reception desk helped me find a good place to eat nearby and overall were very friendly. The bell staff worked very hard to get me a cab at a peak time too. The rates are high, but this hotel is almost always sold out when I try to stay there to visit a friend in the neighborhood, so I'm usually just happy to get a room. The room I was in was somewhat close to the elevator and I heard a lot of hall noise through the door. The free wi-fi is very much appreciated too. Breakfast was included too but I didn't give it a try - preferring to go to the Chicago Diner.

Reviews.Title: “A homely comfort”
Reviews.Author: TalkingTravel
Reviews.Content: Days Inn Chicago lies within the northerly suburbs surrounding Chicago's city centre. The property itself may appear slightly dilapidated to some, however it provides considerably comfortable and homely accommodations. It is at this hotel that I have, quite possibly, had some of the best sleep that I have ever had (albeit with earplugs in). To begin with, I was allocated a room on the hotel's front, facing the very noisy Diversey Pkwy. Shortly after arriving to my generously sized room, I called the front desk to be relocated to a quieter room. Unfortunately, there were none available in my room type, and I was asked to wait to the following day for a room change. This was quickly arranged the following morning, and I was moved to a very quiet, interior facing room, although the room itself was considerably smaller. This did not bother me in the slightest. I might add that I was perfectly able to sleep, regardless of the street noise, as I had an unfortunate experience from my prior hotel, whereby I was unable to sleep all night. In addition, I was wearing earplugs. The new room was very much the same. Well equipped, comfortable and most importantly, much quieter; although it was considerably smaller. The room provides adequate amenities, and is very clean. The bathroom is quite small, however it is perfectly adequate. The television is an older cathode ray style set (CRT), but it works, and the air conditioning unit is also of older style, and did not appear to cool the room down in the slightest. The rooms also feature an in-room safe, which is always a positive. The complimentary breakfast is plentiful and well presented. Food items include, but are not limited to, cereals, doughnuts, croissants, freshly made waffles, Bagels, muffins, coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice. A vending machine for snacks and drinks is available in a room adjoining the front desk, in addition to clothe washing appliances: all for a very minimal fee. There were very few negatives to my stay. The first, was the fact that my room was very noisy. This was soon rectified. The rooms and their furnishing's could do with a modern update, although they are quite comfortable and adequate as is. I was never able to take a shower, as the hot water would flow sporadically. I was required to take a bath each and every time, as the water temperature was never stable. The complimentary in-room coffee and condiments were only refilled occasionally. At one time, I was required to call to arrange for some sugar and milk substitute to be brought to my room, however this request was fulfilled immediately. The property features no restaurant facilities, although it is a stone's throw from multiple restaurants, many of which are quite good! There is also no room service, spa or swimming pool. No gym lies within the hotel, however guests are offered complimentary access to a gym nearby. Days Inn Chicago is not an upscale hotel, so the fact that it is lacking these services should be expected. I will also add that I did not feel it was in the best location for my needs. To reach the city, the most appropriate avenue is via the train line, which is a 15 minute walk from the property. If wishing to visit Lincoln Park or Lincoln Park Zoo, it is approximately a 30 minute walk. It is in a very suitable location for Lincoln Park, but not if wishing to frequent the city. Otherwise, Days Inn Chicago offers a comfortable, homely atmosphere for all guests. It is by no means a classy or luxurious hotel, but it certainly does the job, and it does it well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to see the Cubbies!”
Reviews.Author: bellamia123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn for 2 nights to attend a few Cubs games. We stayed in the most "economical" room - the room with one full-size bed. Yes, it was small, but for the rate (99 per night) and location, it was an overall good value. The room was extremely clean and had a lot of art-deco style charm, but also included the standard amenities found in any Days Inn property. The front staff was courteous and friendly and the breakfast, although just pastries and doughnuts, was clean and well-maintained and definitely much more than you could expect from a full service hotel breakfast with a $12.95 a person price tag. Yes, parking was $22 a night for valet, but if you're in Chicago, you better get used to paying that much, or more, for parking anywhere you go. Note about the location: The hotel is located in "Wrigelyville," or the Lincoln Park neighborhood, which is a perfect area for walking around and hitting some great bars and restaurants with fellow baseball fans before (and especially after) a game. However, keep in mind that Wrigley is at least a mile from the hotel. Although we had no issue with the walk, and actually, rather enjoyed it, this could be problematic for some. Parking at and around Wrigely is $25-$35 and is absolute bedlam. If you can avoid it, I would not suggest driving.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the Best Days Inn I've Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: lorigirl74
Reviews.Content: After checking other B&Bs and hotels close to transportation, Lincoln Park, and Wrigley Field, I settled on the Days Inn. I'm glad I did. We took the bus to meet friends once, but the L wasn't too far away. The price was great for a hotel in the city, I thought (except for the parking that was done around the corner at the mall). Our room was ready around noon and we got a handicapped room (not requested in my reservation and neither of us are handicapped) but it was a little more spacious than the typical room due to the need for accessibility. So bonus! The lobby was nice, the breakfast bar was standard, the bed was not bad. However, my two complaints would be the hallway noise (very thin walls/doors?) and the time it took for the water to get warm enough to shower (very slow in getting hot water and we were on the second floor). You would think with a handicap shower AND a lowered bathtub with shower water pressure would be better. Neither was enough to report to the front desk, but it should be noted that ear plugs were provided int he bathroom, too.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, tidy hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: runawayvespa
Reviews.Content: The room was large, bright and tidy. The bed was comfortable and internet was fast. Our room was only $80 a night if we booked over 3 nights, so I was happy with the price. There was valet parking, costing $22 a day. After reading the previous review I was glad to see my car returned with no dents. The noise from the street was incredibly loud. We got woken up by several times by fire trucks charging along the street, buses and rowdy people. For the rooms facing the street they need thicker curtains or double glazing, the noise was unbearable. Breakfast options were tasty and I appreciated that breakfast was open until 11, as I usually get up too late to eat complimentary breakfast in hotels. The housekeeping was annoyingly persistent as I rarely let housekeeping clean the room while I stay at a hotel. Even though we had a do not disturb sign on the door housekeeping kept calling and coming up to see if we wanted the room cleaned. On the third day they insisted the room had to be cleaned, even though we didn't want it. The do not disturb sign needs to be respected! The location is good, there are plenty of pubs and shops around. Buses stop outside the hotel and trains into the loop are a 5 minute walk away

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE-DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: jell12345
Reviews.Content: The valet damaged my car and tried to hand the car back to me like nothing had happened. My taillight was shattered and the surrounding body was dented and missing paint. When I realized the damage they had to have known they caused, I went to the front desk to speak to the manager who gave me the worst, most disrespectful, and unprofessional attitude and offered no form of compensation or incentive to ever stay here again. Of course they wanted to avoid any blame and did nothing to reciprocate or make me ever want to stay here again. I was still charged the near 50 dollars a day for valet, despite the damage done to my car. I also had to wait an hour for a valet manager to arrive so he could make an incident report. This was my third time patronizing this hotel and surely my last. My girlfriend's mother was going to stay here when visiting her and we were sure to warn her and change her mind.

Reviews.Title: “Inviting and efficiently run ''Home Away From Home''...”
Reviews.Author: Katshi
Reviews.Content: The Days Inn at Lincoln Park in Chicago is an inviting and efficiently run, "home away from home" for me whenever I visit my kids in Chicago. My recent stay in March was pleasant and comfortable as I have come to expect, with the friendly professional staff from the desk and valet services to housekeeping, everyone helping to make my stay in Chicago at the Days Inn cozy and convenient! The location is great, and a nice breakfast is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: xiola
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by a friend in the music industry, who has stayed here many, many times. I could not be happier! Perfect location, extremely friendly and helpful staff, awesome breakfast, comfortable rooms, valet parking with the option to take your car in and out as needed - this hotel has everything you need. Check out their Facebook page for specials and packages.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and good value”
Reviews.Author: petesrig
Reviews.Content: We were visiting DePaul U with our daughter and chose this hotel because it was on DePaul's list and because of the reviews on Trip Advisor. It was very nice. The staff was friendly and prompt and everything was clean and cared for. There is self-parking close by and valet parking as well. The continental breakfast was good with decent coffee. We are vegan and were delighted to find soymilk offered along with cowmilk. We reserved an executive level room. It was large for an older city hotel, with a walk-in closet with a mini-fridge, and an alcove with the desk. The bathroom was new and spotless. We've stayed at the Four Seasons Chicago in connection with my husband's work, and our accomodations at the Days Inn didn't suffer from comparison. The only negative was the noise level--our room was over the front entrance. Rooms in the interior and back would probably be quieter, and for this kind of location, you have to expect noise. The hotel had provided earplugs. Our daughter has decided on DePaul, starting this fall, so we'll be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Chicago-great budget choice during the week”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's a Days Inn. But it's in a great north side neighborhood. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Very clean. Rooms a tad small. During the week, the place is a bargain. I paid $91 AAA rate. Weekends--unlike most Chicago hotels--are higher. So if you weekend stay overlaps to Sun-Thurs, rebook at the lower rate. Also, free use of Bally's gym around the corner. Somewhat near the Diversey Street L CTA stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - with a great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: beijarflorx
Reviews.Content: Not to far from underground station. The room was a bit smaller than other hotels we stayed in in america and only had a double bed which seemed small compared to the other hotels. Hotel spotlessly clean - bathroom - breakfast included and had a impressive variety of things. Would recommend definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good location, awesome breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ktmac250
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a quick weekend trip to the city. It was perfect for the amount of time we were there. The room wasn't very big, but being only there for one night it wasn't much concern. The staff was very professional, helpful, and friendly. Be sure to grab breakfast before you leave! There were a lot of different food options and all very good. If you are looking for a good little pub there is one a few blocks away called the Duke of Perth. We stopped in to grab a quick bite and some drinks before heading to a concert.

Reviews.Title: “This is a GREAT hotel at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Labatt
Reviews.Content: I came to Chicago for a quick trip to see friends in a show, and picked this hotel for its proximity to the theater. I didn't expect much from a Days Inn, but the price was right. But the place has the great charm of an old hotel, and is very well maintained, spotlessly clean, and really quite nice. I would have expected to pay far more for a Chicago hotel. It's in the Lincoln Park district, so not in the Loop area, but there are trains nearby. It's a very solid choice, and I'll be back if I have reason to be in this area.

Reviews.Title: “This place is funky”
Reviews.Author: jmmr
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice here in the last 3 months. Oyur daughter is planning on attending DePaul in the fall so we have been attending events etc. The staff are wonderful, especially Neil and Anthony. We paid the DePaul rate of $85.00 plus $22.00 for valet parking a night. Complimentary breakfast is good,wit a waffle maker and great fresh squeezed orange juice. wifi in the lobby. Worked well. Free wifi in your room. The rooms are so-so but the surrounding area is fabulous for shops and restaurants. The burger place next door is amazing(but expensive). Overall good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dorian_6_7
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very nice. The room was very clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We did have an issue arise as we were packing up to leave and the manager was very accommodating in helping us resolve it. Thanks to the wind in the "Windy City" the bellman's cart rolled off the curb and into our car. The manager quickly came out to look over the damage and assured us that they would take care of it. She was very helpful through the whole process and covered the charges of the body work without our insurance company getting involved. We really appreciated the service we received during our stay and the cooperation we received resolving our car damages. If you are looking for a clean place to stay that offers great service I would really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base in northside Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ntfraz
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times and have found it to be consistently reliable for quality of rooms, friendly and efficient service (front desk, valet parking, breakfast room - everything), and a good night's sleep (ask for a quiet room). It is an outstanding value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended to me by a well-traveled Chicagoan!”
Reviews.Author: sinanissimo
Reviews.Content: I'm a well-traveled, recent graduate and I do love traveling within budget without sacrificing on the quality. First of all, this is not your typical Days Inn near the highway exit and gas station. It is a small boutique hotel at a great, great location! So, I decided to make a quick trip to Chicagoland, but wanted to avoid the expensive and touristy Downtown area hotels. The lady where I work who is a Chicago native told me that they always tell their friends to stay at the 'Days Inn Lincoln Park' and I kinda raised my eyebrows when she said that, having not really great experiences at other Days Inn hotels. So, overall: - Feels like those small inexpensive hotels in Paris or other European cities. Practically chic boutique Days Inn. - Great location! Very close to L -Diversey station and Jamba Juice, Movie Theatres, Walgreens, nice restaurants are all within couple of blocks! Seriously, the location can't be beat. - Usually great price! - Free breakfast & free fast wi-fi! - Very clean and well-kept rooms! - Friendly and professional staff! I mean, for the price I paid, I really couldn't have asked for more! I'm definitely going to stay here whenever I can!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: gieret
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to Chicago & I've stayed here all 3 times. It's the cheapest hotel around, but is in no way cheap! The staff is wonderful & helpful, the rooms are always very clean; some are small, just depends on what you ask for. I always get the exact same room because I liked it the 1st time I was there. The beds are like heaven! They are so comfy & the pillows are like sleeping with your head in God's hand! I came home & ordered some for myself!! Close to pretty much everything you'd visit Chicago for; close to Wrigley, tons of pubs & restaurants, the lake & pier, and all the theaters, which is why I was there each time. I went to Chicago knowing nothing about the location of these places or where to stay or how to get around & the staff here were of the greatest help. Will always stay here every time I go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but will go elsewhere next time!”
Reviews.Author: jenmal1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for exploring Lake-view and Lincoln park, which is what we wanted to do, but the rooms are small, and we paid extra for a large business class room and it was small. No exhaust in the bathrooms, and a noisy storage closet that was frequented by staff constantly. It's not a bad place, but for the money (125.00 a night) we expected more. Now the reason we will not be returning is we left the room to venture out, and left the do not disturb tag on the door, but upon our return we noticed that someone had been in and left a note on our laptop stating that if we continued to smoke, we would be fined 200.00. We don't smoke! We did notice someone partaking in a little ganja, but it was not us. Now while I can understand the need to remind guests of hotel policies, I do not feel it was necessary to enter our room, with all of our valuables laying out, they could have easily slid it under the door, or called us, but instead someone basically made us feel unsafe by just walking in when it was obvious we were not interested in being disturbed. This was a safety issue, and one I am not willing to take another chance on at this establishment! Safety and privacy at this hotel needs to be addressed, because if I were in the room asleep and just did not want to answer the door, or having fun with my wife and did not want to answer the door, someone would have just walked in on us!

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: Vidlar
Reviews.Content: We knew the room would be small, and it was. The towels were also small and thin. The bathroom did not have an exhaust fan. It was difficult to close the bathroom door and then difficult to re-open it. You could hear other hotel guest coughing, and even blowing their nose. The TV is an older picture tube model, but there are plenty of cable options. The location is fine, but for the money, I would keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: capitalgull
Reviews.Content: There is very little not to recommend about the Days Inn Chicago. Although not in the heart of downtown, the transport system in the Windy City is good enough that you are never far from anything either by bus or the 'L'. DIC is a matter of a few minutes walk from the Brown Line and only 20 minutes from downtown if you hit things spot on. The hotel itself is surrounded by bars, cafes, pubs and restaurants of varying nature and should really satsify just about every taste you could think of. The room I had on the second floor was very near the tiny lift, but I never heard it at all, and the hotel in general was quiet despite being obviously fairly busy during my three nights there. The beds, as another reviewer commented recently, were ultra comfortable and my only slight complaint, being tall and fairly stout, was that the toilet in the bathroom was very close to the wall and very uncomfortable to sit on properly. Facilities were, in general, superb and the breakfast was worthy of having every morning I was there. Plenty of choice and nothing ever seemed to run out. My only other observation - if you have a laptop and want to carry it with you when on holiday, then take it to the DIC - their public access computer is, frankly, hopeless and crashed every time I tried to use it after only a couple of minutes. But I am not going to let small details like those spoil what was an excellent stay in a quirky little hotel with excellent staff and comfortable rooms. I'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant- Beautiful little boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HirschAustralia
Reviews.Content: Beautiful little boutique hotel. Had one of my best sleeps there! Rooms are lovely, clean, great beds and bathroom was great. Free Wifi; great and diverse free breakfast. Friendly and accomodating staff. Restraunts were close and within walking distance. Felt like a safe neighbourhood, could walk aroud day and night. Would stay there again happily next time I'm in Chicago. I've stayed at a lot of Days Inns and this was by far the nicest!

Reviews.Title: “Quality doesn't have to cost a fortune”
Reviews.Author: ryanmfitz1
Reviews.Content: My first stay at this hotel was over the 4th of July weekend. I was beyond impressed with the location in comparison to other hotels, not only the cleanliness of the rooms or the professionalism of the hotel staff, that prompted me to stay again for my birthday in August and this is where I found out just how the could amaze me even more..y best friend came with me and had a fantastic birthday, at your establishment. As always, the staff was top notch, and can't find even one complaint. So I wanted to let you know how impressed i am with the house keeping. To let you know how fantastic of a cleaning job they did, i hadn't shaved in a week and thus, i had lots of facial hair. I trimmed it first, prior to shaving which left trimmings unfortunately scattered around. The next morning, when we left to let housekeeping do their thing, when i returned, I swear there was not even 1 hair trimming from the night before, ANYWHERE in that bathroom. I was amazed. I felt bad when i left that morning but their cleaning seemed virtually magic. I was impressed beyond belief. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. You don't have to spend a fortune to have great service and even then, doesn't guarantee you top notch service. I am spoiled by your hotel and everything/everyone. Top notch all the way and will never stay anywhere else when i come to chicago and as u see on facebook, i recommend and give the highest praise to your property

Reviews.Title: “The service and welcome here are really notable”
Reviews.Author: JaneLondon_10
Reviews.Content: I have been here many times and have always intended to write a review because the staff here are so good, so friendly and informative and it is a real home from home in its approach to guests. It is not a luxurious hotel, but very clean and functional and good value for money. It is well located for restaurants and transport and in a nice little neighbourhood. I am writing this from reception which is small, welcoming and a friendly place to be. The meeting room is good and good value. it is right by reception so if you need anything the staff are right there. Jane from London

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonable priced hotel on North side”
Reviews.Author: EllicottCity_MDMoose
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice as it is convenient to people that we visit in Chicago. The first time I stayed I had a room located "off the street". It was very quiet and I was quite pleased. The second time I stayed I ended up with a room that overlooked a busy street. It was ok but not very quiet due to fire engines, motorcycles etc. The free breakfast is quite good with a number of choices. Free internet is also a plus. I will stay here again, but request a room not facing Diversey.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: skirooster
Reviews.Content: I've found Days Inn hotels to be reliable - clean and really good values. The Days Inn at Lincoln Park is a really nice hotel. Don't expect 5 star luxury; just clean, nicely furnished rooms at very reasonable prices. A really good choice -

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ebennett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Days Inn while we were in town for a game. We would stay there again. The staff was so nice. The room we had was big. However my sister in law got just the 1 bed room and it was really small. I say pay the extra $10 to get the room with 2 beds. It was a nice location. Walking distance almost anywhere. We walked to the Cubs game. It was never loud or dirty. The breakfast nook is a little small. But breakfast was good. Also I like the added security they have. You can not use the stairs or the elevator with out your room key.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location+great rate+comfy sleep = awesome Windy City stay!”
Reviews.Author: lau2359
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on 2 things: the reviews here on TA & its location! First the hotel: We parked across the street at a meter and went to check in. One of the first people we saw was the man at the valet stand. He lifted his head to look at us walking through the door, but didn't say a word. We next passed the bellman, who didn't even meet eyes with us, much less say hello. They were the only sour notes. The check in was pleasant and the front desk people were very friendly. Our room had 2 double beds and was huge! Room was clean & beds were comfy. We were right on the street and it would be loud at night if you don't travel with a fan...we don't leave home without ours. : ) I loved people watching out our window...and Walgreens right across the street came in handy a few times. I didn't ever personally make it to the breakfast, but my hubby did and came back to the room with different yummies every morning. Free breakfast with the awesome low rate can not be beat!
