Now location: Lincoln Park is a wonderful base for your next trip to Chicago...we parked our car at the hotel with in/out privileges for $22 a day, but never took it out. We walked to Wrigley Field for a Cubs game and enjoyed some "dolla no holla" tacos at The Bar Celona where the service was excellent We walked just down the street from the Days to The Half Shell for killer crab legs and then headed to Kingston Minds for some rockin' Jimmy Burns Blues starting at 9pm on Wednesday and trust me, Jimmy knows blues! We also did Chicago Near North Food Tour and it was just okay...not the best, but not the worst. We did end up renting bikes at Bobby's Bikes ad going along the lake, through the Lincoln Park area including the FREE zoo, and back to some of the neighborhoods that the food tour took us through - Old Town is a great place for lunch. Stay here...you won't regret it. Our next trip is already booked!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: canadaguyToronto
Reviews.Content: This old Days Inn is in the heart of Lincoln Park and a short walk to Boys Town.The hotel was clean and the free breakfeast was a big hit. My only complait are the bathrooms. Time to upgrade! They all have this 3 inch step up which is just great to trip over at 3 am in the dark. Other then that this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: travelerIrvine_KY
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for 11 years and will only stay when in Chicago - staff is wonderful and Steve the manager is always willing to help

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Shakeandblake
Reviews.Content: Cheapest decent hotel in Chicago that I could find. Nice large room which was pretty modern looking considering the age of the building. Appreciated the free WiFi and the fact that you have to swipe your key to get on the elevator or stairs- extra security (though somehow the pizza delivery guy was able to get up to our room, must have an agreement with the hotel.) Street noise didn't bother me too much. Breakfast was great, although the room was a little cramped. The only complaint I have is that its hard to pull up to the front of the hotel to get valet parking ($22/24 hours) Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: ld4ivy
Reviews.Content: The Days Inn Chicago is an great value in a city where hotels and parking can be quite expensive. The hotel is located about 6 blocks from both the Lincoln Park Zoo and the El stop (subway). It is on the border ot the Lincoln Park and Lakeview neighbourhoods, which gives you more of a feel for the city than staying in the central business district. The neighbourhood is safe and you are close to good entertainment and Wrigley Field. The transit system is easy to use and a multi-day visitor card is both convenient a good value. Ths staff is both friendly and helpful and the complimentary continental breakfast is good. The rooms are clean. There is no noise in an inside room even though other travelers have said that nosie is an issue. I would recommend this hotel and stay there again when I return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, but clean and nice!”
Reviews.Author: Dara123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here by myself the night before a group tour and got a single room, which came with a double bed. The sheets are soft and there four pillows on the bed! Awesome. The room is perfect for one or two people. The area is great, although not serviceable by the train, it has buses to the city. The area itself is really upbeat, with a young crowd. Great little shops, restaurants and bars. I'd stay here again for sure if I were in Chicago. It's a nice alternative to the large downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL TO EXPERIENCE CHICAGO”
Reviews.Author: ricaniam
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times and everybody that works there is so great but the one that stands out is Paulina strezelecka is the best helpful friendly. I love this hotel its so close to everything and wont break the bank a must stay.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I were only in Chicago for a...”
Reviews.Author: themightycasey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were only in Chicago for a quick few days, and were looking for a hotel that would be a good jumping off point for a cram-packed schedule (mass transit nearby, busy streets where you could easily flag a cab), at a decent price. Days Inn, in Lincoln Park, neatly fit the bill. Casey checked us in quickly and was full of advice on just about anything I asked about. He became my go-to guy for the next 3 days! At one point, he suggested we check out a specific local band, and even checked online to see when and where they were playing. As well, any of the other guys I talked to on the staff for our stay, were helpful and cool. It's like they staffed the joint with a bunch of my friends from college! Real comfortable. Real convenient. And real cool. I will be telling my friends to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: dogpeopleca
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth or fifth summer I have stayed here for a few days. They offer exceptional service and real value pricing. Wifi is free in every room and the gym/pool around the corner is either free or cheap for hotel guests. The hotel staff is just wonderful. It is mid-price and sort of middle of the road in style and amenities and they always make my stay nice with genuine service, not the type trained in with plastic smiles from corporate headquarters. This is much cheaper than downtown hotels or hotels on Magnificent Mile and easy to reach from those area. Lots of buses go to the stop that is just four blocks from the hotel. Very safe neighborhood with enough places to eat and basic shopping, a nice Borders, a pleasant and quiet Panera with free wi-fi for cafe customers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic mid range Hotel in Great Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: abrigg
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago for the first time to see a play. This was the closest hotel to our destination. It is a wonderful old Downtown hotel in the Lincoln Park area. Great neighborhood with plenty of shopping, restraunts, and bars. Pet friendly area (not a pet friendly hotel), close to everything in Lincoln Park. The Staff was fantastic, went over and above for us several times. We had a Double Queen business room and it was very clean and roomy. The beds were divine! Haven't slept that well in months. They also have a very nice continental breakfast that includes Belgian waffles (my fav). Valet service was great and there were cabs available at all times. Also has a bus stop out front if you are going to stay for awhile to make the visitor ticket worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful place to stay in the Lincoln Park neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: kathywhoryou
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel years ago. I was pleasantly surprised by the great rennovation that had taken place. The room was fresh and clean, with duvets on the bed. How nice not to share a blanket with strangers! The room was well supplied and the valet parking well priced at $22 with in and out privellages. The breakfast was included and adequate, although bananas would be a nice addition. Every staff encounter was pleasant. It is obvious that the staff is invested in customer relations. The only negative about this hotel was the noisy AC/heating unit that is in the window. It is very loud. Management is aware of this and supplies ear plugs. They may help some but we found the noise disruptive to a good nights sleep. However, even with that it is a good value for the $ in an expensive city and we would consider staying there again on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Coloradoroadtripper
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the quality and service of an upscale boutique hotel with the price of a budget hotel. Staff was helpful and knowledgeable, the room was huge and very comfortable. Located in a fantastic neighborhood. This is a GREAT value!

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ilovevegasbaby
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago so we had no idea what to expect of any part of the city. We wanted to stay around the Loop area so we would be closer to things, but there was a large convention in town and the Blackhawks were also playing for the Stanley Cup. I read some pretty good reviews so I felt comfortable about choosing this hotel. When we arrived on Sunday around 1:00 we were unable to check in as a room was not ready. The girl at the front desk said a room may be ready in an hour or it would be guaranteed at 3:00pm. She said we could check our luggage at no cost until that time. This was fine with us because we were ready to eat lunch and take a walk down to the beach near the lake. By the time we returned it was very close to 3:00 and our room was ready. There was a different person checking us in and when he pulled up our information he said that we were now upgraded to a larger room. We didn't know what we did to deserve the upgrade, but we were very happy about it as I heard some of the rooms were very small. Our room had plenty of room. We had a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker. It had a futon type couch in the room that would double as a bed for someone (sheets and blankets in the closet). We did not have a view because we were facing the inside of the building which was fine with us as I had heard the outside rooms were a bit noisy due to the traffic on the streets. The airconditioner worked really well in the room. Of course it was pretty rainy and cool while we were there so it wouldn't have had to work too hard. A plus to the airconditioner is that it helps drown out noise from other rooms. While we didn't hear our neighbors too much you could hear all activity in the hall. They do give you one set of earplugs just in case you are bothered by noises. The bed was very, very comfortable. The room and bathroom area was very clean. The front lobby is very nice and would always have people gathered around the seating areas which seemed so inviting. The breakfast area is very small and narrow though and felt too cramped when we went down two mornings. We only grabbed a coffee and juice because there were too many people. The elelvator is very small and only room for about 4 people - without luggage. The hallways to the rooms are very dark, but not scary. The numbering to the rooms is confusing. The staff was always very friendly and very helpful when we had questions. The elevated train is about four blocks from the hotel and very easy to use. There are several shops and good places to eat close by. I was very pleased with our stay. The hotel has a great follow up email program so you can express your opinions about your stay. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BAD”
Reviews.Author: Luvmotox
Reviews.Content: 1. Called to see if there was valet parking and was informed that there was. However, there were cars parked directly in front of the hotel, so we self parked around the corner. 2. Scary elevator 3. Room numbering is a mess,,,,, 4. Corner room, VERY tiny. had to walk in the door sideways 5. Tiniest bathroom on the planet, no counter space at all. 6. Whenever anyone else in the building or adjacent rooms or what have you, flushed or used water-the temp of the shower water SKYROCKETS!! This happened to me as I was washing my face. Nothing compares to scalding hot water!!! 7. Front desk staff very impersonal I would definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accomodations and staff”
Reviews.Author: Ralph24
Reviews.Content: We book the room several months ago because of our Amtrak connections. Was very pleased with the accomodations and the staff were all very helpful by providing directions that were needed and helped load our luggage when we left. The breakfast was very good and plentiful. Everything kept well stocked and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “CUBS GAME - CHICAGO WEEKEND”
Reviews.Author: Ndee
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - not your typical Days Inn - in cool area of Chicago with bars/restaurants all around and close to other cool areas on the North side ... FUN 15 walk up Clarke to Wrigley and close to beaches. We took cabs & walked a lot so no input on bus/train.... Breakfast was a little above most with belgian waffles and a few other niceties... Place was pricey but we stayed over holiday weekend during Cubs/Cardinals so take that into account......... I would def stay here again, especially if back for a Cubs game.....

Reviews.Title: “Another great time in the Windy City!”
Reviews.Author: soloonthego
Reviews.Content: I've been flying in from Ohio for Cubs games 3X's a year for the past 5yrs & this is my 1st choice in hotels! Quick, courteous staff, easy in/out, great location & always a clean room! Good selection at the breakfast buffet, though as mentioned a little tight in that area..I sometimes arrive early & have never had to wait for a room & they keep my bag free after checkout until after the game. Front desk staff is always available w/helpful info & suggestions. Location is great--dozens of excellent shops & restaurants within walking distance, though I always make Renaldi's Pizza (on Broadway, just down from Wal-Greens) my first stop even before checking in! Another trip planned for Memorial Day, hopefully back again in June!

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE TO STAY CHEAP TOO EVEN AT LAST MINUTE”
Reviews.Author: railfanMichigan
Reviews.Content: Nice place easy to get too near a main bus line. I ended up staying here for national train day. Its a nice hotel from the lobby with bell hops and everything.. checked in at 3:30PM no problems. nice staff. Has free WI-FI but it's SLOW . Its T1 and compared to comcast high speed it's slow. when you check in they ask if you brought a laptop with you and if yes they give you the password for the wi-fi. room was nice and clean but overlooking a ally. I noticed in the bathroom they provided ear plugs and for good reason. if you open the window for air its noisy. every hour there was a fire truck or ambulance going by. the A/C wall unit if on fan only is LOUD. for heat it was quit. also someone was always slamming a door or something.I never used the earplugs though. when i went to wash my hands the water was rusty for a couple seconds but cleared up. was not rusty anymore after. Later when i wanted to take a shower i could not get any hot water. trying both handles. after a while i figured out the problem. the handles were backwards. the H for hot was on cold and the C for cold was on hot so once that was figured out shower was nice and hot. bed was nice and clean and fluffy. and 2 different kinds of pillows. soft and hard so i mixed them for sleeping 1 soft 1 hard.checkout was fine. overall so far i would stay here again cause im not picky.

Reviews.Title: “great stay and great location.”
Reviews.Author: jamesvia
Reviews.Content: Our apartment was being painted and the fumes were so bad we needed a hotel. The Days Inn was great. Room was very clean and employees very nice. It felt like a little vacation for one night. Thank you Days Inn Chicago, did not even know you where in my neighborhood. We will send our family and friends there when visiting.

Reviews.Title: “SCARY!”
Reviews.Author: Do_not_enter_
Reviews.Content: We are currently sitting in this hotel writing this review. We are so afraid to even walk down the hallways by ourselves. This place has a very scary feel to it that makes us a little but weary and nervous. The worst part about all of this is that the lock on our door was putvon incorrectly, and thus it does not lock. We currently have a chair in front of the door and we are in the process of stacking our bags in front of the door as well. Knock knock! who's there? Orange orange who? orange u glad that u stayed at the days inn in Chicago! No! The rooms are clean and it's in a great location but I'M FREAKIN SCARED OUT OF MY MIND and I want my mommy! Hope this review helped! Oh btw the remote doesn't work and the toilet won't stop flushing! And the walls are paper thin. The people next door are taking a shower and we can hear it very clearly!

Reviews.Title: “decent stay for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: melissaosu
Reviews.Content: Very clean but we weren't all that impressed with size of the room. The bathroom was very small - virtually no counter space. Bed was also very small but at least the sheets were clean. We just went for a weekend trip over St Patrick's Day so we didn't plan to spend much time in the room. We joked the biggest object in the room was the television. Our hotel confirmation listed "Private Parking for 22.00 a night". After we circled around the block, looking out for a garage, we called the front desk and they told us it's valet parking only. 22.00 a night we thought was reasonable. Breakfast was good and open till 11am unlike some other places which only offer till 9 or so. Only complaint is the walls are PAPER thin. We could hear word for word conversations from next door. Really not a bad place to stay for a quick trip. No bad vibes here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Chicago”
Reviews.Author: imasportsluvr
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Days Inn Chicago when we were visiting DePaul University. First the good news. The staff was wonderful. Very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located 3-4 blocks from the El -- very convenient. Breakfast is included and had everything from cereal to waffles. The orange juice, although from a machine, tasted like fresh squeezed. The neighborhood is nice, too. Now the not so good. The hotel is old but updated as much as possible. We hated the heater in our room -- didn't work right and we melted the first night. Someone fixed it the next day and things were better but it was very noisy. The bathroom is old and very small. The housekeepers took our box of tissues after the first day which was bad because my daughter had a wicked cold. It's the only hotel I've ever stayed in which provided ear plugs along with the soap and shampoo (no conditioner provided by the way).

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: oooooooooooo
Reviews.Content: Without question, we would stay here again! Excercise facility is around the corner at "Bally's" no charge for suana/steam, lap pool, or equipment. I have walked further in a mega hotel to get to the suana so this was not an issue for us. Great bus and taxi access. "AA" for attitudes of staff and management. This facility is a great value for the cost. If you do not care for smaller spaces or need bigger for special occasions do not take the value room. There are double queen rooms with desk, safe, ironing board, and good sized bathrooms. Shower pressure is great and housekeeping is impeccable!!!! Everyone knows the story of why you don't lie on the bedspreads. Well these actually get laundred here!! Washer/dryer on premises. Driving? Valet parking here is $22,(this is approx 1/2 the rate of other hotels, especially in the loop). Leave your car and do bus (5.00 all day or 2.25 one time)or taxis, anywhere from 8 to 15 with tip just about anywhere!! Movie theater within 1 mile and food galore, in this Lincoln Park section. Also there is a FREE breakfast in the am and coffee all day!! Good luck and happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: h0teln0mad
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were extremely gracious and went out of their way to welcome me. I arrived early and the staff had a room cleaned and ready for me promptly. Property is located right in the heart of Lincoln Park and there are numerous dining and nightlife options at the property doorstep. I will definitely return to this property. The Days Inn brand gets a serious upgrade in my mind with properties of this character.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: MarcyS4
Reviews.Content: Beds wern't too comfortable and rooms were small but didn't spend a lot of time in the room anyway. Staff was friendly and welcoming and the breakfast was very good and offered a lot of variety, rooms were clean. nice neighborhood. Id stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here instead of inn at Lincoln Park”
Reviews.Author: consumer01
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, clean rooms, newer, good value

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: RoyaleWithCheese71
Reviews.Content: Such a great place to stay in Chicago! What this hotel is not: Fancy (although the lobby has some very nice seating areas). What it is: Affordable, clean, quiet, and convenient, with a genuinely warm and friendly staff. I booked a few months in advance to make sure I wouldn't be scrambling to find an affordable room for our short May visit. I explained that it was just myself and two children, that this was the kids' first visit to Chicago, and that we'd need to get around the city via public transport. When we arrived in May and checked in, we had been upgraded - at no additional charge - to a suite, so that we would have more room to stretch out. The king bed was massive enough to comfortably sleep all three of us, and there was a separate dressing area with full-length mirror, which was a nice bonus. The bathroom was tiny but immaculate (and anyway we didn't come to Chicago to hang out in the hotel bathroom). The free breakfast was a godsend, with two hungry kids ready to take on the city each morning. We did the "make-your-own-waffle" routine - fun and really pretty tasty - but the kids seemed to prefer the donuts and juice (go figure). Location-wise, the hotel is in the Lincoln Park area, so it's a bit off the tourist-beaten track (which, it must be said, I prefer.) But it's close to a number of bus and El lines, and within walking distance of both Lake Michigan and the Lincoln Park Zoo, which is free. (Did you catch that? Let me say it again: FREE.) With younger kids in tow, I found it necessary to pay for transportation to the farther-flung attractions in the city, but one could feasibly walk downtown if one had enough time to spare and the right pair of shoes. Best of all: The staff was marvelous, directing us to the closest bus and El stops, and helping us plan routes to the sites we visited each day. At one point my MP3 player refused to charge on the laptop I'd brought, so they helped me locate a place to charge it up (thank God, or I'd have gone nuts on the long, late train ride home). When an old friend stopped by with a bottle of wine one evening, they lent us a corkscrew. The doormen hailed cabs for us. Every member of the desk and door staff, and even a couple of the housekeepers, recognized and remembered us as we came and went, frequently asking about our day and how our outings had gone and if we'd enjoyed ourselves. We plan on making another trip to Chicago in the next year or two, and I would definitely stay here again. I've also recommended it to a number of people. Lovely!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: jgthompson2
Reviews.Content: A bit long in the tooth, but a very friendly staff, free continental breakfast and reasonable price given location ,make up for it!

Reviews.Title: “big breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: auditgirly
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights. good location with plenty of restaurants nearby. staff helpful although not even their service could prevent the free wifi fiasco with printing. internet cafe nearby solved the issue. easy transport on the el with a transit pass only 2 blocks away. get a quiet room at the back - we didnt and the noise from staff in the side alley having a cigarette til past midnight was unpleasant. the big breakfast buffet was fab - waffles, breads, pastries, cereals, coffee, juices, fruit - yummy! good value and we loved chicago. hotel has apologised for the noise and wifi issues and promised me a free upgrade next time - shame its such a long way from the uk.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: floralbrigades
Reviews.Content: i only had a night in chicago, and this was close to a few restaurants and bars i wanted to check out. the neighborhood was cool and had some good shopping. i had a hard time getting into the city from here, mostly because i got confused with the buses, but it's still in a good spot. the rooms were clean, and my room was quite large, so i was pleasantly surprised. the staff were so nice and really helpful they drew up plenty of maps for me. the website had mentioned that it used to be a bit of a rock and roll hotel, and sure enough one of the bands i was in town to see were staying there! but thankfully the walls must be thick because i a very quiet, peaceful nights sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Girl Time!”
Reviews.Author: falexander123
Reviews.Content: Very Awesome! Close to everything! Rockin' City! I love Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and value”
Reviews.Author: JPIowa
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Days Inn for the Chicago Marathon. The price was an excellent value compared to what we would have been charged for a downtown hotel. The location is still very good, in a neighborhood with many hip restaurants that looked very safe, and a few blocks from the metro/subway. Neil at the front desk was outstanding in helping us with our needs, going beyond the call of duty to ensure we had a pleasant stay. No problem with valet parking. Breakfast included the opportunity to make humongous waffles. The room was spacious, clean, about what I expected. We also had free wifi. I would definitely go back to the Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: JaneyfJaneyf
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here and i really like the place, the staff are great and really helpful, there was one guy in particular who has been on the front desk everytime i have stayed, i cant remember his name but he seems to be senior and he is really nice. The room was a little small but there was enough space and you are right up the road from wrigley field. Breakfast is ok, nothing too healthy on it but still ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice, Convenient to Everything”
Reviews.Author: ATallOne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a three nights toward the end of September, 2009. I had booked a standard king size room, but at check-in, was upgraded to a business suite, which we appreciated very much. This is probably one of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed in; and also one of the quietest. I had a room facing interior courtyard and heard absolutely no street noise the entire stay, and very little noise from the hallway. They offer an excellent free breakfast, with delicious make-your-own waffles. Every one I spoke to at front desk were very professional, very attentive to your needs, especially a young man named Viktor, who had some excellent choices for nearby restaurants . I would absolutely stay at this hotel again, and have recommended it to several friends. Chicago's a great city with lots to see and do, and this hotel makes an excellent home base. Close to L station (Diversey - three blocks) and in the middle of a great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Just a nice place”
Reviews.Author: RIKKASDAD
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here toward the end of September, 2009. Our room was spacious, bed was comfy, and bathroom bordered on elegant. The building is kind of an odd shape--almost a square with a "courtyard" in the middle. We were on the 4th floor facing into the courtyard, and our room was very quiet. I'd guess that the lower level rooms on the Diversey or Clark might get noisy--there is a fire station nearby. Elevator is SMALL--last time I saw one like that was in Rome. We flip flopped our reservation a couple times, and service was still pretty good. Location in Lincoln Park is terrific--it is a vibrant and diverse neighborhood, but still felt pretty safe evenat night. Not a place for single F walking late at night though--it is a city after all. Parking is tough. Twenty plus bucks a day. The whole city is not car friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/performance ratio”
Reviews.Author: OmerErol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is relatively close to the downtown. it takes about 20 minutes to Magnificent Mile to the heart of the city by bus. Room was tiny but clean. Its comfort is more than enough if you just need a place to stay at night. Probably you would prefer to spend your time out Chicago.. Days Inn is good choice.. My only negative comment is about the guy at the receptionist. he was not nice and does not know anything about hospitality..

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not great.”
Reviews.Author: gymlver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a super location: lots of restaurants, good transportation nearby, shopping, attractions (zoo), bars, etc. The one problem we had was that the doormen or bellman (hard to tell which were which) had bad odors. It hits you as soon as you get in the doors. They hand out just inside the front doors to the hotel. I think the check in staff should be awarre of this since they have to walk past these smelly guys too. Otherwise, I don't have many complaints. The rooms are a little small but you really can't beat the price for the location. The front desk is very nice and very good about answering questions. There is one computer in the lobby - two would be better since it is hard to get on it most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room...noisy in the morning.”
Reviews.Author: cjdeperro
Reviews.Content: I picked the Days Inn because my friends lived 2 blocks away, and it seemed to be in a nice neighborhood. Well the neighborhood is great....a 2 block walk from the L, passing all sorts of mid and upper range restaurants, fast food, Walgreens, CVS, Borders, Starbucks....all very nearby. The hotel is very nice too, nicer than a standard Days Inn. The room I had was in a far corner with no view except of an alley, but that was fine and kept it quiet--overnight anyway. The bed was great, internet was great, though the bathroom was a bit small. There was a fridge and microwave in the room. Unfortunately, I was located near the staging area for the housekeeping staff and they did not seem to know to 1) keep their voices down in the morning; 2) not slam into the service door with the carts, and 3) OIL the darn service door, it creaked like crazy! Fortunately I'm an early riser so I heard most of this while already awake, but I can't say that on principle it didn't bother me. I would however stay here again, just not in that corner of the hotel. Oh and the continental breakfast...nice, but if the hotel is full plan on taking things to your room, there are not enough seats.

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal value”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelSeries
Reviews.Content: Obviously this is not a 5-star property in the terms most people think of it. My rating is based on the fantastic value a visitor gets in a very expensive city. I write travel books and am doing one on Chicago. I thought this would be a great base of operations for one of my trips: in Lincoln Park, good bus and L, continental breakfast - all for under $69. It was all I hoped. The rooms are very small, but all I wanted to do was sleep and write, not have a party. Things were very quiet, staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There were absolutely no downsides. Tip: Save money and time on the valet parking and do it yourself. There's a 24-hour-a-day self-park garage about fifty yards up Clark Street (north of Diversey). It's several dollars cheaper than valet service and you don't have to wait. Just walk there in two minutes and get the car. The free wi-fi is great for somebody there to work.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the $, great location & EXCELLENT customer service!”
Reviews.Author: tnl69
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I came up this last weekend for PRIDE. This hotel is above & beyond what I would, stereotypically, expect from a Days Inn. The location is perfect for PRIDE or a weekend in "Boystown". This hotel is very welcoming to LGBT travelers (as evidenced by an in-room informational sheet on the PRIDE parade - which by the way, goes right by the hotel!). Everyone from the valet folks, to the bellmen to the front desk personnel were VERY helpful(they even offered to call a local eatery, to see when they closed, for us). The $22/a day for valet parking is well worth it as street parking in the area is hard to come by. It also affords the option to come and go as you please, w/out additional fees. The continental breakfast is pretty good too! We will definitely stay here again and will recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Dan1113
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good hotel, located close to buses and the metro. The rooms were decently-sized and had all the amenities we could need. The negative sides: -The computer is really restrictive, pop ups do not work for example. My boarding passes were in pop ups so I had to go to an internet cafe in order to be able to print them. -Weak breakfast. Donuts for breakfast, seriously? -Noisy, but we did have a room facing the main street. But these are pretty minor points. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and nice people too”
Reviews.Author: barbcleveland
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights beginning June 21. I arrived late at night and I was given a very small, nice, but very small room. I asked if I could be moved the next day, as I was staying for 4 nights. Neil was so nice and helpful and I was moved to a bigger room. Anthony was helpful too, as was everyone there. It was an easy ride downtown on the Broadway bus, and there are restaurants and a Borders very close to the hotel. You can use a gym that is just several doors away. There are bigger and smaller rooms, with different shapes and sizes, so it is nice if you can get a larger room. All rooms seemed clean and modern and with nice bedding and beds. I would stay again in a minute. Book as early as you can, as it fills up. Have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location! You can't go wrong.”
Reviews.Author: Joel85
Reviews.Content: This is not your typical Day's Inn. This is a completely renovated, modern older hotel in a great neighborhood. Found this is Hotwire for $53, cannot be beat in Chicago. Room was immaculately clean, beds very comfortable. Coffee, microwave and fridge in room. Free wireless internet with access code that they change every 2 days so you may have to get it updated. Free continental breakfast with fresh squeezed juice and the ladies work very hard to replenish. Staff very friendly and helpful. Always at least three employees at desk and lobby area and they usually hold the door! I highly recommend this hotel. You can't go wrong. L about 8 blocks, bus stops right at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, but not for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: blueleo65
Reviews.Content: First, let me just say that I had a nice time staying at the Days Inn in Chicago. I chose the hotel for it's location close to the Halstead nightlife. I wouldn't have chosen it if I wanted to be downtown in the traditional tourist area. The front desk and valet ($22.00 per night, isn't bad for Chicago) clerks were very professional. The Lobby is in my opinion very nice and tasteful, for a hotel at this level. The furniture and decor were charming without being over the top. The building itself is very old, and the renovations did not seem to have changed the original layout of the building. That in my opinion would cause some to think of this hotel as less than adequate while others will find it very charming. I stayed in a room with a single double bed on the 4th floor. It was small. and the view wasn't exactly exciting, overlooking a made up courtyard, I'm sure done up as a joke. the bathroom was tiny, and didn't have much room for toiletries, but for my purpose, it was adequate. I did enjoy using the facilities at the Bally's Fitness around the corner, which were complimentary (excellent value). Overall, if you don't mind some the disadvantages of the building itself, it is a very charming and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to Children's Memorial”
Reviews.Author: Lesmira1960
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night. Room was clean and comfortable.Breakfast was plentiful. Front desk recommended a good Italian restaurant for dinner. Computer for guests use was slow and kept crashing! Quite frustrating for a number of guests!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything! Very clean!”
Reviews.Author: lyoung88
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple on a budget and enjoyed staying at the Days Inn in Chicago because it was economical, clean, and close to a bus line (2-3 blocks) that took you anywhere in Chicago. Staff was extremely helpful when it came to explaining the bus routes, etc and the continental breakfast was very nice. Rooms were teeny tiny but comfortable and clean. The hotel itself was older, but had been renovated in a modern way. Parking is close - you can bypass valet and park yourself two blocks away. It is cheaper but you can't move the car in and out like you can with valet. The diversey park area seemed safe and had a college-town vibe. Lots of good places to eat nearby and hole-in-the-wall pubs - loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn at Diversity and Clark â€“ an OK stay! Why? NOT anything special!”
Reviews.Author: DreamyOahu
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed at this property off and on since 1993. Iâ€™ve seen this property grow from an almost raunchy hotel to an American standard hotel. My last stay at this hotel was in March 2001. PLUSESâ€¦ 1.) rooms are significantly cleaner than back in the 90's and 2001 2.) lobby is much nicer 3.) mattress is very good, entirely better than back in the days CONCENRSâ€¦ i.) Polish speaking nationals. yes, they now have 99% Polish speaking personnel in the hotel which either do NOT speak ANY English or too little to make heads or tails of anything they attempt to say or even comprehend. This is NOT positive! The United States is an open door, however, we MUST insist that people who are employed in this country at some point MUST speak some English; even if they are predominantly in housekeeping. How do these people have their working papers for the country anyway? They probably don't ... sharing SS#! ii.) toilet brush REQUIRED in the bathroom iii.) no iron or ironing board in the room iii.) no refrigerator in the room Also, I didn't appreciate leaving U$100.00 smoke security. In addition, they quabble about 800 phone calls. It is a good hotel for one night. It is what I would refer to as a quickie hotel. U$85.00/night including the tax is too much! The best price is U$69.00 including tax.

Reviews.Title: “It is an excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: mikek01
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the staff and our room. Public transportation was a short walk away. We felt safe in the neighborhood, and there was many dining options with in walking distance. The staff was very friendly and helpful to us as we were first time visitors to the city. We would definitly recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying here.”
Reviews.Author: elocs
Reviews.Content: I came with my 16 year old grandson on spring break. The room was excellent. Clean and the bed was comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Security of having to use your room card for the elevator was nice. The continental breakfast was good. The location was handy to bus and train transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, no surprises!”
Reviews.Author: airguy
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Days Inn Chicago. The staff was friendly, the breakfast was excellent, the room was comfortable and clean. I woke up refreshed and relaxed. The hotel is about five blocks from the transit station, a walk that I found easily manageable. I also enjoyed being able to get in a workout at the Ballys Fitness next door. While the hotel was not "luxurious", it was well kept, functional, and definitely reasonably priced for the location and amenities offered. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good option.”
Reviews.Author: silicon_rain
Reviews.Content: A great hotel - just what we were looking for. Days Inn is just a middle-of-the-road chain hotel, so don't expect anything fancy and you will be very happy. The lobby is beautiful, with very nice staff. The room was a little on the small side and not brilliantly modern, but spotlessly clean and completely adequate for those not looking to spend their holiday in their room. The bathroom could have used a bit of an update, though, and the air-conditioning was pretty loud. The free breakfast was fantastic - one of the best I've had. Just about anything you could want and lots of it. The DIY waffles were especially tasty. The location was pretty good. We had to get a train and then a bus from the airport, which took a while and wasn't that easy to navigate. Once there, getting to downtown was easy on the bus (the hotel staff directed us to a place around the corner where we could buy tickets from), but we walked a couple of times (although it is a good 45 minutes walk each way, so I wouldn't advise it if you're not a strong walker). The neighbourhood was very nice, with some nice places to eat and such nearby. The Lake Michigan shore is not far away, and walking along the beach to get into town was a lovely stroll. The Lincoln Park Zoo was just 10 minutes walk away and is well worth a look since it's free. On the whole, if you're not looking for anything massively fancy, then the Days Inn Chicago is definitely for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value in Windy City!!!!”
Reviews.Author: blockthatkick
Reviews.Content: What's up with this place?! It is the cheapest hotel in the city, and it is right in the middle of the city! The room was clean, staff was attentive and helpful to the out of town guest, and the breakfast was very yummy! Book this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in an expensive city.”
Reviews.Author: Maltloaf
Reviews.Content: I've only got two issues with this hotel, it's a three block walk from the nearest El and the air con is noisy but apart from that it's terrific value. It's in an interesting and safe neighbourhood with good bars and restaurants within easy walking distance. The staff are amazingly helpful and the rooms are clean, the bed comfortable. What more do you want? There are buses nearby which go into downtown and when i go back to Chicago, this is where I'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: kickice
Reviews.Content: First things first, I couldn't quite believe how cheap this hotel was (under Â£35 a night for a room), but then I was staying in the middle of winter! But after being used to New York hotel prices (where that kinda of money wouldn't even get you a grotty room with a shared bathroom), this was a very pleasant surprise. Location wise, the Days Inn is in the very cool neighborhood of Lincoln Park. It's easy enough to get to downtown from here - the #22 bus stops right outside the hotel, and runs day and night. The Brown Line El runs quite close too (Diversey is the closest station, not Belmont as a reviewer down the page states!). It's a few minutes walk to the station. You can buy transit cards for the CTA (buses and El), from the Currency Exchange store across from the hotel on N Clark St. Lincoln Park is an ideal base as well for theatres (Steppenwolf, Victory Gardens, 2nd City and others are in the nighborhood), and it's close to Wrigley Field. It was absolutely no problem at all staying out of the downtown area, and in fact it was nice being in what is a lively, interesting residential neighborhood. The hotel is a good size - not too big, but not a tiny place either. Staff where pleasant and ready to help - but to be honest, the place was so well run I didn't need anything, or have to ask many questions anyway. Room was a decent enough size. Clean, comfortable, with desk, big closet, drawers, chairs, TV, coffee maker. Bathroom was small but perfectly adequate. Breakfast was included, and was available from 6.30am. Plenty of coffee, juices, cereals, bagels, muffins, toast, danishes and waffles. I would be more than happy to stay at the Days Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems, good service!”
Reviews.Author: parabolove
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago and Days Inn made it even better! It is a great bargain especially for the location. The hotel was clean, the staff was so darn nice, the free bfast was mmm soo good- the muffins were amazing, fresh squeezed juice, and even make your own waffles. The only complaint is the drain in the shower wasn't working as smoothly as it should have been. I can't see how anything could go wrong here and even if it did, front desk was just so ncie!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great neighborhood although the rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Do you like paying $265 to stay in the loop at a chain hotel or would you rather pay $90.10 and stay in the Lakeview North neighborhood just a short CTA subway ride up the Brown Line. If you are like me, you will save your money for the great restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. Yes, the rooms are small. And the elevator is small. But this is not your typical Days Inn. Clean as a whistle thanks to the Polish speaking staff. And quiet. Perfect for the single traveller on a budget. And oddly , this is one of the few Chicago hotels that has lower rates during the week (and higher rates on the weekend). Lots of Cub fans I guess. In any event, Chicago is an over priced hotel market that has only gotten worse in the last year. This is one of the few bargains.

Reviews.Title: “good price”
Reviews.Author: daniel g
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly good. I've stayed at a few Days Inn (typically bad experiences) so I was hesitant about booking this one. Using Hotels.com I couldn't beat the price so I decided to give Days Inn one more chance. (Reading the reviews from Tripadvisor gave me a little more courage than I would have otherwise given this chain.) Clean accommodations, decent location and a convenient 7 minute walk to the 151 bus line (Diversey and Sheridan), which travels the length of Michigan Avenue. The hotel is also near DePaul University so there are a lot college-aged kids walking around. Parking at the mall (Century Shopping Centreâ€Ž self-park) was $18 for 24 hours (somewhat below average as far as Chicago area parking is concerned.) My wife and I enjoyed dining at El Nuevo Mexicano Restaurantâ€Ž and Sushi 28; both are just a few minutes walk from the hotel. Weâ€™d consider staying at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “upstairs downstairs”
Reviews.Author: SouthCarolinaMax
Reviews.Content: Our hotel visit was booked through Hotwire. We were given a single double bed. . The desk clerk made it clear that we couldn't have two beds since we booked through a "third party". After finding a place to park a few blocks away (parking is atrocious in that area and the hotel clearly pushes their expensive valet parking) but it is possible, although the clerk also warned that it was nonavailable due to permit parking and meters. We didn't use the car again until we left, opting for CTA passes. The common areas of the hotel downstairs were pleasant. The breakfast room was comfortable and the continental breakfast sufficient, surprisingly offering "real" orange juice. The entire hotel was kept very clean by the friendly and professional staff. Access to the Bally gym next door was certainly a plus. Upstairs was a disappointment. Our room was really tiny. The old closet was deep and dark so retrieving items was a challenge. It appeared that the upstairs was not sprinkled anywhere, making their nonsmoking policy mandatory (although one evening we smelled someone smoking near our room). The room was incredibly stuffy and there was no way to get fresh air, nor was there any exhaust fan in the bathroom. As a result, it was necessary to run the huge and very noisy air conditioner nonstop. I guess the old clawfoot bathtub would be a novelty to some, but the corner showerhead made for difficult and long showers, since the pressure was low and modulating water temperature almost impossible. Pluses: location! cleanliness! common areas! Minuses: room I would probably recommend booking directly with the hotel in order to ensure a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MoTravelin_girl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a girl's trip to Chicago. I booked solely on written reviews....and boy were we impressed!!! For the price, this hotel is PERFECT!!!! The beds were great, rooms were very clean, breakfast was the best....waffles...YUMMY...and the staff was so helpful and friendly!!!! Great location to public transportation. Highly recommend this property!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: feltephant
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! My husband and I stayed here for the first two nights of our honeymoon roadtrip. It was a great location. There were many places for us to shop (used bookstores, vintage clothes, quirky boutiques), lots of good restaurants, as well as a drugstore right across the street and it was a nice, safe walk to and from Wrigley Field. Also very short walk to Oz Park, Lincoln Park Zoo, and the train. The price was decent for the area, free internet in the lobby, adorable elevator. The room was pretty small and cramped but we weren't there to hang out in the room all day. It was cozy. Cool little bathroom with claw foot tub. I can't say enough about this hotel. We really enjoyed our stay there and will definitely stay there again when we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: princessvixen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gem.The rooms are huge.We had 2 queen size beds and so much room you could fit an army inside! The bathroom was tiny but it didnâ€™t bother me.My friends were on a higher floor and they had a frige,microwave and an even bigger room.Staff at front desk always friendly and free internet a bonus.Location is excellent and no problems!

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the ciy”
Reviews.Author: indy4192
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn in Lincoln Park on our baseball trip to chicago. We picked it for two reasons. First and foremost was cost. We got a room with 2 double beds for $117 for the night. Second it was within walking distance (1.5 miles) of Wrigley. Well the hotel was great. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. There was a huge closet and the bathroom was clean, big and the hot water in the shower was perfect. The hotel people were more then nice and the free morning breakfast hit the spot. The location while might be "nosiey" for some, didn't bother us after a day at the game the walk up and back. We were also close to the "L" and was able to hop it to downtown. If you are looking for a clean, comfortable room, with a great location at a reasonable price, then this Days Inn is your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: merchieb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Days Inn Chicago, 644 W. Diversey Parkway, July 15-July 17, 2008. Fantastic Hotel! I can't say enough good things about this place! The location was great, close to train and city bus stops. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and quiet. The bed was so comfy! The free breakfast was tasty. Best of all, the price was low compared to other hotels in the area. A quality hotel for the money. When I return to Chicago, I will stay at this hotel again and recommend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A well-run hotel -- and an exceptional value.”
Reviews.Author: exmontrealer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Days Inn Lincoln Park North for years, but returned this month after a two-year absence. The property's actually better-looking, better-run, and better appointed than my last visit. The staff -- who field guest requests literally 24 hours a day -- was unfailingly courteous, the valets and bellboys helpful, and the housekeeping staff thorough and polite. The manager couldn't have been more solicitous when he happened to overhear a question I had about directions. I've spent much more at hotels that delivered a lot less; this perfectly located hotel is an exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: timer13
Reviews.Content: Not too much to add to previous reviews. We had a room overlooking the interior courtyard and we thought it was quite spacious, but looking at the floorplan on the door revealed that there are other courtyard rooms that are a bit smaller. Our bathroom was not small, but there was very little space in the toilet area. A very large person would feel a bit cramped. The step up into the bathroom is a bit dangerous even with all the signs. Loved the a/c. It cooled the room and provided good white noise for sleeping. Complimentary breakfast was good. Staff were very friendly and leaving our luggage for several hours after checkout was no problem. Wrigley, Boystown, and the El are all walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for Cubs Fans”
Reviews.Author: lovesthecubs
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago last week to catch a Cubs night game, and picked the Days Inn Lincoln Park mostly for its price (about $140 including taxes for a double-bed room) and proximity to Wrigley Field. Although I expected only the most basic lodging for that price in this area, we were pleasantly surprised with the cleanliness, comfort, and hospitality this hotel provided. The bed was very comfortable, A/C fully functional, floors and carpets were clean and free of stains/wear, service personnel friendly and attentive. The area itself is full of shops, convenience stores, and restaurants all in close proximity. Parking is a nightmare, however - we resorted to the hotel valet which was a reasonable $22 per day. The valets also provided outstanding service. The only negative was the bathroom. Although it was very clean and the water pressure adequate in the shower, the bathroom itself was extremely miniscule, making getting ready for the day a little tight for the two of us. A minor drawback for such an outstanding value. We walked to and from the game, which took us a little over a half-hour. The area felt reasonably safe, even when hoofing it back from the game at the end of the night. We will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Glad it was only for one night...”
Reviews.Author: zoohouse
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Days Inn in June. We parked around the corner and it was an easy walk to the hotel entrance. (No need to bother with valet service.) The front desk staff were friendly, efficient, and helpful. The manager directed us to a great pizza place, Lou Malnotti's (sp?). He said that it is better than Giordano's - and we had to agree that it was just excellent. Really excellent staff all around! The hotel is located in a great neighborhood. A one mile walk to Wrigley Field and a 10 or 15 minute walk to Lincoln Park Zoo. The el station was about four blocks away and the bus stop was around the corner. The neighborhood is nice and there's lots of places to eat and stores to check out. We went to Second City and it was a blast as usual. The reason I was glad it was for just one night is that the room was TINY! It honestly felt a little like a glorified closet. I'm sure there are larger rooms there...but whoa, ours was small. I did like the character and feel of the place though, even though it showed a few signs of age. The bathroom had only a shower, but it was a very nice and clean shower. I would stay here again for an overnighter in a fun neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn is the best in Lincon Park”
Reviews.Author: BrianTheMusician
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Days Inn for years. The current staff is amazing. They are very helpful and they will go the extra mile. The hotel has been rehabbed over the years and is in it's best condition it has been in. Get a business room if you want a little bigger room with a little nicer experience. I am not saying the regular rooms are not nice, they just tend to be on the tight side. But I stay in both types and if you are looking to save a little for dinner each night, get the regular room.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Lincoln Park North very cozy”
Reviews.Author: Kari24
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and cozy. Bed linen and pillows extremely comfortable. Coffee maker, iron, ironing board, safe, hair dryer, microwave, refridgerator, and snacks all included. Definetely would stay there again. Reasonable price for the location. Valet service kindof confusing, still a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Frogee
Reviews.Content: This Days Inn is a good value. Rooms are quiet, at least if you are not facing the street. A variety of interesting restaurants in the area, such as the Creperie and Pars Cove. A short walk to buses which go downtown. Unless you feel the need for valet parking, park around the corner at the Century Parking Lot and save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Days inn Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: bereakentucky
Reviews.Content: I stay here exclusively and get homesick when I am not able to make a trip to chicago! The staff and management are the best. The breakfast is great, rooms are too, and its the best bargain in terms of location. Most people think staying on Michigan Ave is the thing, but in terms of things to do at night, proximity to events, restaurant choices, and simply the neighborhood....well, this place cannot be beat. It has been my best kept secret all these years....if you want fancy, this is not your hotel, but if you want a place to be thats near all the places to be, its Days Inn Lincoln Park for me!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: geoffg32
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 nights through choosechicago.com and got a nice rate (under $100). The rooms and bathrooms were very clean and fairly spacious. Best bed I've had in a hotel. Free breakfast was decent. The staff was friendly and the Lincoln Park location was convenient (15 minutes downtown by bus). Certainly not a full-service, downtown hotel, but more than adequate and much, much cheaper. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: lennon2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised by my room here - I expected something small and cramped, but I found the room to be spacious. The bathroom was a little small, however, but still not bad. Every staff member I encounted was friendly. And the breakfast is worth getting up for - a variety of juices, breads, pastries, and waffles are offered. It's a little out of the way for tourist-y attractions, but I felt it was worth it. It was easy to hail a cab out front. The one downside I found was that the stairwell was rather narrow; however, the hotel does offer an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: pumpkinhead2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Days Inn on my first trip to Chicago. The price was very reasonable, the rooms very clean and the staff friendly. The surroundnig area of Lincoln Park was very nice, although a way out from the Loop. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place and Location for the Money”
Reviews.Author: cubsgirl72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on New Years Eve 12/31/07-1/01/08, since we were clubbing in the area. Great location to Clark/Broadway/Diversey. Great neighborhood. The hotel staff was very friendly! The room was a double queen bed room, the beds were more of the size of a full bed. Bathroom was ample in size. The hotel rooms vary in size because the property used to be a condo bldg converted into a hotel. The room I had faced out to diversey, considering it was New Years Eve, it was very very noisy with people passing by all night and talking loudly. It's a run of the mill hotel but it was better than anticipated. The breakfast buffet in the morning (9am - 11am) was free and it had fruit, cereal, waffles, bread, bagels, muffins and croissants. It also had coffee, and dall different types of juices and milk. Very unexpected and a nice touch! This location would be good for those that want to be close to Lincoln Park Zoo, Wrigley Field and tons of bars. You are also a short cap ride away from Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Best Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms are small (European style) but the housekeeping is first rate. The staff are very accommodating and helpful and the hotel is extremely well managed. It's in a lively location, convenient if you're traveling by bus. Bus 22 and 36 stop right on the corner as does 76. From O'Hare, take the Blue line to Logan Square then the 76 bus to the hotel. With all the subway construction on the Brown line, it's just not practical to take the subway to get to the hotel. One word of CAUTION! There are about four rooms that do not have the combo heat/AC units installed yet. If you're "lucky" enough to get one of those rooms, you probably should request a room change. Those rooms have a small air conditioner in the window with side panels that let the cold winter air right through. Supposedly the steam radiator provides heat but it "cycles" on and off and no one seems to know whether it will cycle on during your stay (or even your lifetime) and it does get cold in Chicago during the winter. But if you get one of the other 120 or so rooms you will find a modern HVAC unit that will keep you comfortable all winter long. Not sure why the hotel has not installed these in all rooms yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: ash2882
Reviews.Content: I came to Chicago for business October 24th. I searched all of downtown for a good deal. Everything seemed to be so expensive or gross and scary. I came across the Days Inn in Lincoln Park and found it to be fairly close to downtown. It is a hike from Ohare but fairly easy to the city. There is plenty of restaurants and stores within walking distance. The rooms are quiet and very clean. All white bed linens. Not the biggest room (queen size bed) but it is exceeds your expectations of a Days Inn. The bathroom is very clean and nice. I found the front desk to be very helpful and friendly. For my first trip into a big city alone, the hotel made me feel very safe, secure and comforted. An unhappy hotel experience was the last thing I needed. I would highly recommend and encourage others to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: jvsgooch
Reviews.Content: We actually live in the suburbs of Chicagoland, but had family coming for the weekend who wanted us all to stay downtown so they could see the sites and go "clubbing" at night and could grab a taxi back to their hotel afterwards rather than having to drive back to our house at night--wise choice! Unfortunately, it was a busy weekend, most hotels were booked solid, and, the only rooms available downtown started at $400 per night--at least according to the various hotel booking sites on the internet. According to the Days Inn central reservations, this hotel was also booked solid, however..... ...Important Tip! Even if all the internet hotel reservation sites and central reservation center for a hotel chain CLAIM that a particular hotel property doesn't have any available rooms, it is usually worth a shot to try calling the hotel property directly, as they usually "hold back" a few rooms for phone reservations and their regular guests. I like to call the hotel after midnight and talk to the night auditor, which is what I did, and sure enough, he was able to "force" the system to book a reservation irregardless--and was also able to give me a special "package" rate of $132--really good rate for this particular weekend! (When calling the hotel, do not select the menu option for reservations - "1" as it will transfer you automatically to Days' Inn central reservations; Instead press zero '0' to speak directly to the hotel's front desk staff.) In truth, I called 9 other hotels as well which were supposedly booked solid, and found only 2 that had not held a few rooms back. However I booked at this Day's Inn because of its reputation and exceptional Lincoln Park location--an upscale neighborhood which is safe and secure, close to Lincoln Park Zoo (free admission!) with numerous eating establishments and popular clubs--walking distance to Cub Stadium (about 1 mile) and easily accessable to Navy Pier and "the Loop" via subway, or by hailing any one of numerous taxis that run directly past the hotel at all hours of the day and night. Taxi cabs in Chicago charge very reasonable rates, our ride to Navy Pier, for example, was under $5. OK, so maybe this hotel isn't The Drake or a Hilton, but far superior to any other Day's Inn we ever stayed at. The beds are all "triple sheeted", meaning there are 2 top sheets that completely encase the blanket for added cleanliness. The furnishings were a little older, but very clean. The free deluxe continental breakfast includes fresh Belgum Waffles which you make yourself by pouring the preprepared batter into Waffle Irons, along with complimentary copies of USA Today, and complimentary day membership to the Bally's Gym next door. Free "wifi" and expanded cable are also included. Parking: You can either park your car yourself in the self-parking garage located next to the hotel ($14.95) or use the hotel's valet services ($20). There is also metered parking available on the street outside the hotel if you don't mind returning every couple of hours to "feed" the meters. Overall, we found this hotel to be a good value for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “I like the Lincoln Park Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: tudomany
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the past 15 years. It is quiet, clean, moderately priced, and very conveniently located near several bus lines. Clark Street, on which it is located, is a major shopping street, and there is parking at the nearby Century Mall. I have found the staff to be friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “So good that I almost don't want to tell anyone about it!”
Reviews.Author: NKC
Reviews.Content: Forget your impression of the Days Inns as being a chain of down market, shabby properties. This place is not only the best Days Inn I have ever seen; but also one of the best places to stay in Chicago -- even though it's not in the Loop. The good points: Location! North Clark and West Diversey in the heart of the Lincoln Park residential and shopping district -- an easy, safe 1-1/8 mile walk from Wrigley Field past great shops, bars, and restaurants, and about the same distance to Lincoln Park Zoo and the waterfront. Valet parking is $20 per night, fast, and reliable -- a bargain for Chicago. Every room has very fast wireless internet service at no charge. The executive rooms are apparently newly remodeled and refurnished, quiet, very clean, and fully appointed -- and about half the price for a comparable room in a downtown hotel. Service is exceptional by any hotel's standards. Everyone -- from the valet parking attendant to the bellman to the front desk staff -- rank among the best I have encountered in Chicago. We left a valuable item in our room when we checked out. In many hotels it would have been lost. The Housekeeping staff secured the item and left a message at our home phone number before we were able to call them. Nothing at this hotel could be considered a "bad point," but here are three very minor issues: Because of the structure of the building (which apparently was not built to be a hotel) the hallways and rooms are very dark. The included buffet breakfast is a good value,but the dining room is small and sometimes uncomfortably crowded. Again, there is not much that the hotel can do about this without cutting into the quality of the breakfast. The hotel could use a second elevator, Bottom line: Great location (especially for a Cubs fan) and exceptional value for Chicago! No wonder this place has been recognized as the best hotel in the Days Inn chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: latinboy1976
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It is in a great local, Walgreens across the street, my bank a few blocks away in both directions, Jamaba Juice next door and my favorite coffee shop Intelligentsia in Chicago only a few blocks north. Yes the rooms are small but I have stayed in smaller (Beverly Terrace in Beverly Hills). But I found the room very clean as well as the bathroom. The front desk folk were great on advice on transport and local eats. The only issue I had with the hotel is at least with my room there should be a sign posted next to the bathroom watch your step. Upon entering I had to use the restroom and almost killed myself since I hadn't turned on enough lights and tripped on the step up to get in the bathroom. The second , third and forth things I didn't like about the hotel was the lack of water pressure, hot water for the shower unless it is morning but even then it is lacking and the VERY SLOW drain in the bath tub. As for the very slow drain in the bath tub I just chalked it up as having old pipes. I unfort. forgot to mention this upon check out as I had an early morning flight and was still half asleep. If anyone mentions this to the staff what is/was their reply? Over all though I did enjoy my stay and just now booked a room for a couple days to let my hair down in Oct.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean and friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JennyStar00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend for four nights. We went to Chicago to see a Cubs game and do all the tourist things as well. I have to say it's a great location if you want to be close to downtown, but not right smack in the middle. First: The Room We had a single queen and the room is a bit smaller than most hotel rooms, but it was perfect. There was a nice section in the room to but all of our luggage and shopping bags, and they stayed out of the way. The bathroom was nice, a large mirror. The downside is there really isn't any room to put your toiletries in the shower, and their isn't a fan. The A/C worked the entire stay and kept our room very cozy. The best part was the bedding. Soft, comfortable down comforter and pillows. I did't want to get out of bed some mornings! Second: Breakfast This was nice. I had a bagel and cereal and OJ every morning. There were tons of other selections as well. I even was allowed to take the food to my room. Third: Shopping Right as you exit the hotel there is a Jamba Juice, Barnes and Noble, Walgreens, and many restaraunts. Renaldis pizza is less than a block away. Also a shopping mall is less than a block away. If you walk a little further you will find a Best Buy, more shopping and more eating. Fourth: Valet The Valet service was very good. I never had to wait more than 10 minutes to get my car. They were very friendly to me. I even forgot something in my car, and the man went and got it for me, instead of having to get my car and take it out myself. That was very nice. EVERYTHING ELSE: The L train is like straight two blocks, when you take a right out of the sliding doors of the hotel. This station was closed during my stay, but the next one was only two blocks down. The L is very easy to take, and was my first time and I used to get all over Chicago. This is a great place to stay. Staff was helpful. Clean hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Okay Room”
Reviews.Author: DukeFan91
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for one night as it was one of the only hotels in Chicago that had rooms and wasn't outrageously priced. The hotel is in a nice area with a bus stop to Magnificant Mile only 4 blocks away, however, the Diversey EL station is closed for the next year (it was only 2 blocks away) making the next closest station a bit of a distance away (7+ blocks) so traveling the EL is somewhat difficult from this hotel...stick with the bus if you can until summer of 2008. The staff was fine, no problems with the valet, and breakfast decent b/c of the make your own waffles...without them, the breakfast would not be so good. The hotel is quite old, the lobby is nice, but the rooms were not as nice. Our double bed room was tiny!!!! There was a bed, a small desk, a nightstand, and a TV stand making it packed. The bathroom was updated, however, the shower was impossibly small. Honestly, the room reminded me a lot of my dorm room in college (ha, that room was really pricey too and not that nice!) Overall, the hotel was okay, but I would recommend staying at the Red Roof Inn just off of Magnificant Mile...it has comparable rates and nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Chain Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ChickenandWaffles
Reviews.Content: Where to start? The rooms are shabby. The beds are undersized. The bedding smelled of bleach. The elevator is impossible. Valet parking took 1/2 hour with nobody ahead of us. Staff is pleasant enough but has no knowledge of the city. We booked this due to its contingency to DePaul University, but that (relative) convenience did not make up for everything else. Extremely disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location for a Different Chicago Experience”
Reviews.Author: haasmail2006
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Days Inn Lincoln Park late in the evening after an exhausting day of travel that started 14 hours earlier. The directions on their website were excellent so we had no problems finding it despite being tucked into a residential / retail neighborhood and they even made sure that we approached from the right direction so we could take advantage of the valet service. The front desk staff may have been the best I have ever experienced. Not only did they help us find Chicago deep dish delivery, they got us menus and coupons and even offered to order it for us. When there was a problem with our room key, they sent someone up with us to make sure that our new keys worked. The hotel is an older building that has been refurbished. The room itself was comparable to other rooms in this class of hotel. The bathroom was small and dated, but clean. As I mentioned, itâ€™s in a mostly residential /retail neighborhood, and on a busy corner. If you are light sleeper, you might have a problem with the noise, but it didnâ€™t bother us. Be sure to request an upper level floor if one is available. The next morning, we enjoyed their complementary continental breakfast including belgian waffles and coffee. We were spending the day in the city before driving back to Ohio, but we didnâ€™t want to get our truck out of valet parking and leave all of our luggage in there after finding new parking. The front desk stored our bags for the entire day for us and didnâ€™t charge us anything extra to leave our truck there until that evening. The hotel is walking distance to Wrigley Field, brown and purple line CTA trains, and Lincoln Park. The neighborhood itself is also great and has good shopping. If you are looking for five stars, this place isnâ€™t it, but it is an excellent value in a great Chicago neighborhood. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a cubs game!!”
Reviews.Author: Strongs
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time to this hotel and it was even better than the first time. Room was clean and comfortable. Perfect place to stay when in town for the CUBBIES!!! Giardinos pizza, cold stone creamery , walgreens, jamba juice and even a shopping mall all just steps away. Staff is nice and helpful. Great free breakfast in the morning. Ask the front desk sometimes they have coupons for free or discounted prices for things nearby. They gave us 5 free coupons to get into Zanies comedy club!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean hotel for the price and amenities”
Reviews.Author: chicagopace
Reviews.Content: Read a number of reviews which for the most part were correct - the hotel is very basic, older, has the a/c units hanging out the windows but does offer a good value for its location in Lincoln Park. I took a flight into Midway, took 1 hour to take the two trains and walk three or so blocks to the site. For $2, not bad and the train ride was pleasant. Just down the street is Einsteins, Walgreens etc. Unforuntately, the hotel had a problem with their power, ConEd had to replace 3 transformers so no a/c, no free internet during the evening and morning. Had to cancel and book another hotel. All in all - just realize there's no frills, the finishes are old and rooms are very small. Friendly service, but not sure why they were Hotel of the Year which to me was misleading.

Reviews.Title: “TINY TINY ROOMS....”
Reviews.Author: nicebizguy
Reviews.Content: First, this hotel is technically in Lakeview, one neighborhood north of Lincoln Park. The neighborhood is great, just wanted to clear that up. The hotel is in good condition, the rooms clean, but boy, is the room and the bathroom are very tiny. Very much a New York sized room. The photos on their website are not really accurate. If you are going to a Cubs game, or just want to get more of the local flavor, this is a good choice. But paying $130 a night for this iis overpriced. If you can find a deal under $100, grab it. Otherwise, I might suggest looking elsewhere via hotels.com for a better deal at a more luxurious hotel for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in April in a suite. This consisted of two very small rooms that the connecting door was taken off of and one bath converted to a closet. The remaining bath was tiny (reminded me of European baths). The window overlooked the roof - which made the room very quiet! The hotel was full and only once did we even hear noises, and they appeared to come from next door. While the towels were pretty flimsy, the nice bed and pillows made up for that. The "continental breakfast" was one of the better ones I have seen, with make-your-own waffles, cereal and really good donuts. The desk staff and everybody working there seemed to go out of their way to be nice. Don't expect anything close to luxury from this place, but it is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: jrs47
Reviews.Content: I was attending a workshop on the north side of Chicago and I wanted an inexpensive place to stay that would be convenient to the workshop (further north) and also to sightseeing in the loop. After reading about the small size of the double bed rooms I upgraded to a queen size bed room. It was spacious, and it faced the inner courtyard so it was also quiet. I got what I was looking for - inexpensive, a safe location, a comfortable bed, and very clean. The Brown Line el station is a 4 block walk, and there are buses going north and south (to the loop) right on the corner on Clark St that run frequently. With respect to other people's comments, the elevator is small but it can easily hold at least 4 adults. The water pressure fluctuates, but the shower control regulates the temperature so there are no surprises! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ssara
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with two friends for one night while we were in town for a concert at the Aragon Ballroom near the Lawrence El. We got a business room with 2 double beds and a roll-away. A somewhat older hotel, but clean and adequate.
