Located in a busy northside neighborhood, with a Panera, Chipotle, Starbucks, Jamba Juice, and the like nearby, plus a good sprinkling of ethnic restaurants. The hotel is an easy few-blocks walk to the Diversey El. Service was a little uneven. We had requested early check-in, but when we arrived at 1:30 our room wasn't ready, so we had to occupy ourselves for half an hour or so. Also the roll-away bed we had requested hadn't been placed in the room until we asked about it at check-in. Valet parking was convenient and easy, and the $20 for overnight on-site parking seemed reasonable for Chicago. On either end of our stay, the staff let us leave our bags in secure storage while we walked around the neighborhood, unburdened. The front desk staff were knowledgable about options for getting to the airport the next morning. The free continental breakfast was nicer than usual and offered in a pleasant sitting area. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rogoashear
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable hotel in a great location, with some shops and restaurants within the immediate vicinity and Diversey Station about 5 minutes walk away granting access to downtown. The rooms were nicely decorated, albeit a little small compared to most places in the states. Very cheap considering the location too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fine location”
Reviews.Author: GelEGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in April 2006 when I was in town for a conference and overall had a great experience (so much so that I've booked the same hotel again). Overall, you're not going to do much better with a hotel in this location (not very far from the Loop, although not really within walking distance to any major attractions) for this price. The accommodations are pretty basic, but for me the biggest plus was the free wireless Internet (really fast connections, too). Some downsides: 1) The breakfast ain't gourmet. But there was an adequate selection of things to choose from, and I left pretty sated. 2) Getting an iron and ironing board my first night was a bit of a hassle. It took about an hour before one was finally sent up to my room (in fairness, they did tell me it would be a long time when I first requested one). 3) The staff really varies in friendliness. I encountered some less-than-chipper people, and one person working the front desk made me feel stupid for not being able to find the elevator (hey, in fairness to me, it's pretty small!) Don't expect to have the red carpet rolled out for you.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best!”
Reviews.Author: xxxxx4
Reviews.Content: Have stayed and reviewed this hotel before, but felt the need to write another review! Best rooms to book are the "business" rooms, which are considerably larger and great for sharing. Staff is most pleasant & willing to help with any requests.Location is a bit north of downtown, if you are planning alot of "miracle mile" activities....any price saving could be lost in cab fairs! That said...the neighboorhood is great (Lincoln Park)...interesting shops and very safe....and if you don't mind taking the bus on Sheridan into downtown it's only $2.00! Also, if you are staying more than a night or two, use the parking garage around the corner on N.Clark for $5.00 less per day (and no tip)...It's where they will park your car anyway! :)

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad I stayed here”
Reviews.Author: biztravelor
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler on the road at least 5 months out of the year. That's a lot of nights in hotels. While I love to stay in the big cities' downtown districts when I get the chance, my travel budget won't allow for $200 plus per night hotel stays. That's why I rely on the reviews in trip advisor to help me make a choice. I have seen some mixed reviews on the Days Inn Lincoln Park north. It's common to see some negative reviews, one can't be something for everyone. But I can say I do not have any thing negative to say. My room was a double. It had fresh paint and carpet. Yes the room was on the small side, but again this isn't a $200 plus per night hotel on Michigan Ave. It had a metal tub (often hotels have the fiberglass ones). The water pressure in the shower was fine. The bathroom was clean. My sheets were clean - new mattress. After watching so many news stories on hotels, I always peel back the corners of the sheets to see if I can find any bugs - none here. I had a window overlooking Clark, Diversey and Broadway. The hotel had a conceirge (very nice) as well as valets for parking your car. I called the valets for my car before leaving my room and by the time I went downstairs my car was there. Security was on site late in the evening. I was suprised that none of the reviews mentioned anything nearby. There's a mall beind the hotel with a movie theatre. A Walgreen's next door. Barnes and Noble across the street. Borders next door. Also at the doorstep is a smoothie place, a nuts and popcorn store, Panera Bread, Chipolte, Buca Di Peppo and lots of mom and pop restaurants and cafes. Boystown was just a short walk away - had a blast on Halsted and felt very safe walking back at wee hours of the morning. The lake is a quarter mile walk east. The continental breakfast was great. My favorite was the big waffle machine. The pastries were fresh. The staff was very nice. I did not have any negative experiences. I would absolutley stay in this hotel again and can't wait until my next visit to Boystown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel in a Great Loc”
Reviews.Author: bernamac
Reviews.Content: We miss this hotel! We were so surprised at the value, especially during the weekday. Now, I am saying COMPARED to other options in Chicago, its a GREAT value. It's not the best place I've stayed. BUT, tell me where you can get a hotel room for under $100 in Chicago that is clean and in a SAFE area. The staff was very friendly. Breakfast is decent, better than most "continental" breakfasts. I'm sorry that others only gave it a 1 or 2. We've stayed here at least 3 times and have recommended it highly to others. Maybe those with only bad things to say have higher expectations in a $79 per night hotel in the city or are inexperienced travelers? If you are looking for a clean, safe hotel and know the right kinds of questions to ask (eg, parking and valet fees), then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place!”
Reviews.Author: whiskfern
Reviews.Content: The convenience of being within walking distance of the Loop is outweighed by the incompetence and rudeness of the people at the desk. When we checked out, we saw that we had been charged a $20 valet parking fee, when we had arranged our own parking. We asked the desk person to remove the $20 charge, which he supposedly did. HOWEVER, I just received my credit card bill, and discovered we had been charged TWICE by this Day's Inn: $317.60 (no valet parking charge) AND $337.60 (includes the valet charge). When I called to straighten this out the person I talked to was not very interested or concerned, told me there was no one there that could help me, and that I would have to call back the next business day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Koei-Seun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in August 06. Had a "business" king room and a "business" dbl. queen room. Both rooms were very spacious and comfortable.That said, I did happen to see the inside of a standard one bed queen room and it was VERY small. The lobby and common areas were all very clean and updated. The neighborhood is safe and walkable.Every staff member was friendly, competent, and kind! Not sure where the writer of the review titled ""SRO Accomodations" (6/26/06) stayed....but it couldn't have been here. Would stay here again anytime I want to be in N. Chicago! :)

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn - Not bad, just not great”
Reviews.Author: BusyMom1961
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, I just arrived home from spending the last two nights at the Days Inn on Diversey. The hotel room was clean and wasn't really small. We were in Room 211. It had a coffee maker and iron, but no microwave or frig,(but neither was expected). The staff help was hit or miss. Some of the staff went out of their way to help you, where others couldn't be bothered. The valet people were very friendly although we didn't use their services. While asking directions to different attractions, some of the clerks gave them and were very helpful, others would have gotten me lost. The continental breakfast was nice, they had the usual bagels, cereal, juice milk, waffles. My real complaint was with the showers; very little water pressure and then you would get a shot of cold water, then it would go back to hot. You could tell when this happened by the scream from the bathroom. Our room faced Diversey and it was loud from street noise. I never heard any noise from the hall ways it was all from the street.. Stair way was narrow,(never used the elevator - it seemed to take way too long) but much quicker than the elevator. Overall, I might stay there again, but would have to really think about it . $300.00+ for two nights seemed a little high for what we got.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Chicago
HotelInfo.Address: 644 W Diversey Pkwy, Chicago, IL 60614 (Formerly Days Inn Lincoln Park - North)
